Title: Business Analyst - Systems Architect

State Role Title: Information Tech Specialist II

Hiring Range: Commensurate with experience

Pay Band: 5

Agency: Dept of Ed Central Operations

Location: VDOE James Monroe Building

Agency Website: www.doe.virginia.gov

Recruitment Type: General Public - G

Job Duties

The Virginia Department of Education (VDOE), is seeking an experienced professional to serve as the System Architect in the Office of Technology and Systems Development, CTO.

The Business Process Development team will work with end users to design and maintain all computer systems at DOE. They will provide the overall systems approach on all service requests, develop new system designs, develop system documentation, provide guidance for enhancement requests, support ad hoc reporting, insure compliance with state standards, and provide overall business process knowledge during process improvement efforts.

Minimum Qualifications

Knowledge and skill in system development methodology including application development, requirements analysis, systems design, computer programming, systems testing, and documentation.
Experience with relational databases, Linux and Windows Operating Systems, WEB based development technologies and methodologies including JAVA, JavaScript, HTML, web server, SQL, PL/SQL.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to manage multiple complex projects with minimal direction, developing project scope, estimates of effort.
Ability to lead project teams including managing and directing multiple developers and other resources.
Experience evaluating, learning, and implementing leading edge integrated development environments and technologies.
Comfortable in multi-tasking, switching priorities with little notice, and handling time horizons ranging from immediate software remediation to multi-year projects.
Experience in project management, supervision or team leadership.
Experience in project management, supervision or team leadership.

Additional Considerations

College degree in information systems, computer science, or related field or demonstrated progressively responsible experience in developing and maintaining information systems.

Special Instructions

You will be provided a confirmation of receipt when your application and/or résumé is submitted successfully. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.

A résumé will be accepted in lieu of a completed state application. Applications submitted via e-mail, postal service, fax or hand-delivered will not be considered. Successful candidates must pass a criminal background check. Commonwealth of Virginia employees may have teleworking options available. Final teleworking agreements will be reviewed and approved upon hire.
Commonwealth’s Alternate Hiring Process:
In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to prove their Certificate of Disability (COD) provided by a Certified Rehabilitation Counselor within the Department for Aging and Rehabilitative Services (DARS). Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS to get their Certificate of Disability. If you need to get a Certificate of Disability, use this link: https://www.vadars.org/drs.cpid/PWContact.aspx, or call DARS at 800-552-5019.

Reasonable accommodations are available to persons with disabilities during the application and/or interview process. For assistance call: (804) 225-2021, [TTY: 786-8389]

Minorities, Individuals with disabilities, Veterans, and people with National Service experience are encouraged to apply. The Virginia Department of Education is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages diversity within its workforce.

Virginia Department of Education does not provide sponsorship.

Phone: 8047508177

Email: humanresources@doe.virginia.gov

Job Title: Consultant, Knowledge and Data Management Services
Job Description:
Enterprise Knowledge (EK) is hiring a full-time Consultant to join our growing Knowledge and Data Services Sector. This position will work directly with the Vice President to support strategy, design, implementation, and advisory projects for our Fortune 500 and public sector clients. In this role, you will be part of a team working on cutting-edge solutions that are developing advanced knowledge, information, data, and Enterprise AI (e-AI) management capabilities to ultimately help organizations achieve their core mission.

As an EK consultant, you will join a fast-growing company that is committed to diversity and inclusion, have the opportunity to work in a collaborative workplace, take advantage of our unique benefits, and help build our innovative culture. Don’t just take our word for it – we were recently featured as one of Inc. Magazine’s 2023 Best Workplaces!

Roles and Responsibilities

Work with the top knowledge and data management experts to design and implement cutting-edge programs/products through strategic planning and implementation of knowledge, data, and AI solutions,
Lead project facilitation and stakeholder engagement models to help clients shape the vision and strategy for successful programs/initiatives,
Work with cross-functional teams to develop project milestones and deliverables - leveraging agile methodologies and approaches to define and manage project workstreams that align with strategic vision and guide the iterative delivery of projects,
Collaborate with leadership to develop internal practices, teams, and strategic initiatives to support growth activities, and
Develop presentations, proposals, demos, and other client-facing materials.

Required Skills and Qualifications

At least 5+ years of experience in agile project/process management and business analysis,
Ability to understand and analyze business requirements to translate them into technical solution designs and implementation roadmaps,
Experience interfacing with executives and presenting to senior-level staff,
Familiarity with content management, information management, information systems, data management, or related discipline(s), and
Ability to navigate ambiguous situations and solve problems through demonstrable analysis process.

Preferred Skills and Qualifications

Management consulting experience for technical solutions leading strategic planning and business development in the management consulting industry,
Previous experience with knowledge, data, and information management,
Experience with leading project / process improvements and working with PMO, and
Experience working with project management and collaboration systems such as Trello, JIRA, MS Suite, etc.

“We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.”

Senior Functional Business Analyst

Position Description
CGI Federal is seeking an experienced business systems analyst with strong customer service skills to provide support for the client's Momentum core financial system and associated integrations. This is an exciting full-time opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment supporting one of the largest organizations for the US Federal government! We take an innovative and collaborative approach to supporting our client, working in partnership to address program needs and keep program objectives on track.

This support provides technical, managerial, or administrative direction for problem definition analysis, requirements, development, and implementation for sophisticated to very complex systems. The support includes analyzing issues and proposing solutions, analyzing business processes and proposing solutions, conducting formal and informal training, assisting with error resolution and troubleshooting, performing data reconciliation, and providing financial management mentorship. The candidate will work with other CGI members and directly with the client on a regular basis, so should have strong written and verbal communication skills and be able to work independently and take ownership of tasks.

Your future duties and responsibilities
Provide functional support in the operations and maintenance of the Momentum application.

Analyze and resolve issues as identified by the client across different Momentum modules.

Complete various reports to identify documents or issues that need to be resolved and work with other teams to resolve the issues.

Work with interface partners to reconcile data and take correction actions as needed.

Document issues and resolutions as well as procedures and processes clearly and concisely.

Perform testing as needed to confirm issues or support system improvements.

Have a desire to gain functional understanding of systems, specifically Momentum, and to build on that knowledge to provide direction and support to our customer. Knowledge share with CGI team members.

Identify and communicate risks and issues to CGI management.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role
Federal financial management/accounting and/or Momentum experience.

Strong MS Office (MS Excel) skills.

Ability to work well with different teams.

Strong analytical skills.

Strong customer service skills (e.g., Ability and desire to develop and maintain productive client relationships.)

Strong oral communication/presentation skills.

Strong written communication skills (both with and without templates).

Strong time management and organizational skills.

Ability to work independently (at client site and remotely) and lead multiple task assignments and priorities.

Ability to work under deadlines and efficiently in a dynamically changing environment.

Ability and desire to advise CGI management of tasking, issues, risks, and opportunities as needed.

Team-oriented, self-starter who owns work to completion.

Bachelor's Degree required.

Minimum 3 years' experience required.

Desired:
Knowledge of Atlassian Jira

CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.

Working at Transurban is different; it's a place where you can see the benefits of your work play out in real life, every day. We create city-sized solutions-building and operating safer, smarter, and more sustainable roads-to solve pressing transport challenges.

About the role:
We’re seeking a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to provide business intelligence services for the 95 and 495 Express Lanes, including data mining, analysis and reporting of operational metrics across the business.

You’ll join an innovative team, who is responsible for timely analysis and reporting to improve business performance and maximize EBITDA.

As our Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you’ll contribute to lasting and positive changes that shape the future of our cities and communities. It’s meaningful, challenging and exciting work.

Day-to-day, you will:
Develop analytical dashboards to improve operations and drive insights through relationships observed in the data.
Build analyses for the purposes of trend analysis and ongoing reporting.
Model development and templates for analysis focus on accuracy, data integrity, reusability and automation.
Mine data from the road operations, traffic and the tolling systems’ databases.
Identify new data sources to bring into data lake, to develop new insights and drive change within the organization.
Prepare and maintain process documentation ensuring full transparency of reporting, data analysis, and the elimination of “single point of risk” dependencies.
Support team members, internal managers and leaders with periodic and ad-hoc analyses.
Liaise with Report Developers and database administrators for data mining purposes and to design and deliver efficient reports and data visualization tools.
Regularly monitor standard reports for historical, trend and forecast, and control reporting.
Support functional areas with business performance analysis.
Carry out ad-hoc reporting and analysis as required.

This role will suit someone with a curious mind and transferable skills and experiences, including:
3-5 years in a business reporting and analytical environment, preferably in a high-volume transaction environment.
Understanding of SQL development, Python scripting, and Tableau experience is highly regarded.
Microsoft Excel capabilities with proven knowledge of spreadsheet modelling.
Demonstrated experience delivering innovative, efficient and effective business process solutions.
Excellent commercial, numerical and analytical skills with a focus on attention to detail.
Strong ability to turn data into business information and concisely articulate performance improvements and enhancements.
Desire to support team members with experience in front-end and back-end development.
Ability to translate complex statements into credible and compelling presentations and concise executive summaries
Demonstrated ability to present to all levels of personnel, including senior management.
Excellent time management and organizational skills, including the ability to work on multiple tasks/projects at any one time
Excellent self-management skills and initiative with a high degree of self-motivation and the capability to take the initiative and work independently
An agile mindset, capable of lateral thinking.
Bachelor's degree completed (a focus in Commerce, Business and / or Technology preferred).
If you meet some of these requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.

With a career at Transurban, you'll enjoy a range of benefits, including:
A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, life, STD and LTD insurance and retirement plan
A range of flexible working and leave options, including the option to purchase an additional six weeks of leave each year.
16 weeks paid parental leave (regardless of gender or career status)
Learning and development opportunities to support your career interests.
Health and wellbeing support-access to Headspace and our EAP program, wellness facilities, and more.
Share offers and insurance benefits.
Social activities, community give-back programs and paid volunteer days.

MID-LEVEL BUSINESS ANALYST

INCATech is looking for a Mid-Level Business Analyst with experience in web content support for a project with the Department of State. This person will be a liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams to adjust content, document requirements and resolve user issues. They will also work to collect, capture, and manage mission user needs from prioritization through concept development and user story writing to support development and deployment. This person will also facilitate the gathering of business-focused requirements to support a product team and product owner in defining the backlog and ensuring the user's perspective is considered.
This position is a hybrid role located in Reston, VA. Candidates must be able to commute to the customer site (downtown Washington, DC) when necessary.

REPSONSIBILITIES:
Work to collect, capture, and manage mission user needs from prioritization through concept development and user story writing to support development and deployment as a business analyst.
Facilitate the gathering of business-focused requirements to support a product team and product owner in defining the backlog and ensuring the user's perspective is considered.
Work with the product owner and users to determine the operational objectives of business needs and elicit requirements.
Provide complete documentation of requirements, user stories, processes, and procedures.
Make website content changes, fixes, and edits to HTML (i.e., broken link corrections).
Utilize HTML and CSS knowledge and experience to align with Agency guidelines and ensure proper web standards.
Create, edit, proofread, and update Web pages using a template-based solution.
Enrich user experience through tailoring of content across the Agency's websites.
Review and analyze stakeholder feedback; support senior staff to create specifications for development.
Adjust website content in collaboration with stakeholders.
Support leaders with content recommendations as part of a website redesign team.
Generate reports from user input and website forms using MS office tools.
REQUIREMENTS:
Qualifications
Related Experience:
MUST HAVE AN ACTIVE SECRET SECURITY CLEARANCE
2-5 years of experience in a business analyst or requirements analyst role
Experience using requirements management tools
Knowledge of the Agile software lifecycle.
Attention to detail when writing features and user stories.
Bachelor’s College degree or equivalent years of experience.
Experience correcting broken links promptly, with comprehensive follow-up.
Stakeholder engagement skills.
Experience w/ Customer Support/ training skills.
PREFERRED:
Minimum of 2 years of experience w/ HTML and web analytics.
Experience assisting in the creation of new website content areas.
Confirm published content complies with best practices, including SEO, accessibility, naming conventions, brand guidelines, tagging, and testing for quality assurance.
Understanding of content strategy and content management systems (CMS), especially Adobe Experience Manager.
Knowledge of web standards and semantic HTML.
Familiarity with User Experience (UX).
Experience using requirements management tools (primarily IBM Engineering Lifecycle Management).
Experience using Microsoft Suite of products (MS SharePoint, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Ability to multitask across multiple projects and clients in a fast-paced, team-based environment.
About INCATech LLC
INCATech is an award-winning small business that has over 14 years of experience supporting the US Government. We provide both Professional Services as well as Transformational Software Solutions for our customers. Our deep technical expertise in Geospatial Information Systems, Enterprise Data Management, User-Centered Design, Cloud & Platform Services, and a wide range of Acquisition Support Services will provide your career the boost you have been looking for. Our culture is based on empowering our staff and customers with knowledge and tools to achieve mission success and career advancement.

Benefits
INCATech offers a competitive comprehensive benefits package. Our most valuable asset at INCATech is our people. Our benefits package is designed to help and safeguard our employees and their families. We provide a variety of life and family benefits to meet a variety of demands. Benefits include: Health, Dental, 401K, Vision, Paid Time Off, Life Insurance etc.

INCATech is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Company Name: US Office of the Chief of Staff of the Army
Job Description:
Duties
Develop plans for the completion of analytical activities.
Conduct continuous analysis and evaluation of program to provide recommendations for improvement.
Leverage analytical capabilities to conduct a broad range of descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics in support of customers across Department of Defense (DoD) and the Army.
Provide analytical expertise to program managers on building program requirements, articulating capabilities, and assessing operational risk.
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance for duration of employment.
Qualifications
Who May Apply: US Citizens

In order to qualify, you must meet the education and experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document.

Basic Requirement for Operations Research Analyst:

Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in operations research; or a degree with at least 24 semester hours in a combination of operations research, mathematics, probability, statistics, mathematical logic, science, or subject-matter courses requiring substantial competence in college-level mathematics or statistics. At least 3 of the 24 semester hours must have been in calculus.

You MUST submit a copy of your transcript with your application package or you will be rated ineligible.

In addition to meeting the basic requirement above, to qualify for this position you must also meet the qualification requirements listed below:

To qualify for the GS 12 Level:

Specialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes applying advanced social science statistical methods and data analysis techniques; seeking out secondary data sources to solve complex problems; and analyzing data to present findings or recommendations. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-11).

To qualify for the GS 13 Level:

Specialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes applying new analytical developments, methodologies, or research findings to broad analysis and/or studies; providing guidance to other employees in areas such as cost analysis, data analysis or operations research; applying research techniques to obtain information concerning subject studies to perform analyses.
This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-12). Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify.

Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. For this job, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone-no substitution of education for experience is permitted.
Education

FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: https://sites.ed.gov/international/recognition-of-foreign-qualifications/

Additional information

This position may be filled at the GS-12 or GS-13 grade level. Management may select at any of the grade levels announced. This recruitment provides promotion opportunity to the target grade of the position without further competition when selectee is eligible and recommended by management. Duties described reflect the full performance GS-13 level. If not selected at the full performance, duties will be performed in a developmental capacity under close supervision.
Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.
You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.
One year trial/probationary period may be required.
Direct Deposit of Pay is required.
Selection is subject to restrictions resulting from Department of Defense referral system for displaced employees.
If you have retired from federal service and you are interested in employment as a reemployed annuitant, see the information in the Reemployed Annuitant information sheet.
This is a Functional Community Requirement (FC) 36 Career Field position.
Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement
Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement.
Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs is not authorized, based on a determination that a PCS move is not in the Government interest.
This position is not remote or virtual.

Job ID: 2315266

Location: RESTON, VA, US

Date Posted: 2023-11-07

Category: Business Development

Subcategory: Business Dev

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: Day Job

Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

Minimum Clearance Required: None

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Public Trust

Potential for Remote Work: No


Description

SAIC is seeking a highly motivated and ambitious Business Development Operations Analyst in our fast-paced Civilian Business Unit (CBU) Business Development (BD) Team, with a desire to positively influence and ultimately impact the success of the Team!

The individual will be involved in all elements of Business Development Operations for the Business Unit including: refining and efficiently managing the communication/reporting/review business rhythm, facilitating knowledge management and ensuring data quality in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database, tracking all business development metrics and preparing information and analysis briefs, and identifying and recommending efficiencies in the optimization of the business development life cycle, all in direct support of the Business Unit’s Business Development Vice President, Business Development Leads, Capture Managers and Proposal Managers. The position will have access to senior leaders and executives that will provide a great foundation to grow across the company!

The position is hybrid – with an expectation that the individual will be available to work out of the SAIC Reston office two days a week

Responsibilities of the role will include:

Manage and optimize the communication/reporting/review business rhythm.
Manage, track, and report on key business development metrics.
Manage action item trackers and document lessons learned.
Synthesize data into actionable analysis and risk reduction recommendations.
Support the streamlining and automation of BD processes and procedures.
Support data entry and data quality in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database.
Identify and implement standards for development and management of a robust pipeline of opportunities.
Support deal qualification and proposal development.
Develop and facilitate training of BD operations, BD tools and win initiatives.

Qualifications

Undergraduate degree and two years' related professional experience working for a Government Contractor in the technology space
Understanding of Business Development, Capture & proposal processes
Strong proficiency in MS office tool suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams)
Experience with a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database
Ability to critically analyze information from multiple sources and provide clear, quality final analysis
Ability to execute critical thinking, problem solving, business acumen, and interpersonal skills to organize and drive teammates to action and standards.
Ability to work effectively in fast-paced, time sensitive and often multi-tasking environment.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with peers and senior leaders
Ability to obtain Secret clearance




Covid Policy: SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.

Description:
The Senior Risk and Business Analyst will provide services on a contract supporting a U.S. Government agency.

The ideal candidate will have excellent problem-solving and communications skills as well as a previous work history of supporting the developing of risk analysis models, tools, and methodologies to enable risk prioritization. This position requires a positive attitude, strong organizational skills, a drive to focus and produce results, and the ability to lead a team to meet objectives and foster strong customer relationships in a complex environment.

This is a full-time salaried position with compensation based on experience and overall strength of the candidate. In addition to receiving a competitive salary, we offer benefits which include medical, dental, vision, STD/LTD, Life, 401k retirement savings with match, Tuition Assistance and a generous paid holiday and time off schedule.

The Senior Risk and Business Analyst will enhance their skills set among a talented and technically accomplished group of colleagues.

On this contract, our team will support the U.S. Government agency across the following activities:

(1) Maintain a comprehensive understanding of risk prioritization and analysis best practices used across the public and private sectors that can inform the program’s risk prioritization efforts.

(2) Support the development of standard risk analysis policies, standard operating procedures, and similar documents to ensure standardized approaches across the programs.

(3) Work with client to identify and collect requirements to support the development of roadmaps, strategies, or plans for analytic tools, software, and platforms.

Core Duties:
Identify existing information and production efforts on cyber threats, vulnerabilities, and consequences.

Prepare recommendations to fill analytic gaps and support risk prioritization.

Collaborate with stakeholders and partners to complete risk assessments, develop improvement roadmaps, and communicate assessment results to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Leverage and enrich cybersecurity data from multiple sources to produce new insights about program performance

Requirements:
Qualifications:
Clearance: Public Trust to Secret.

Citizenship: Must be a U.S. Citizen.

Education: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited academic institution in relevant field.

Experience: Minimum of 5 years’ experience providing similar services similar projects.

Preferred: Experience working in IT and cybersecurity environments at one or more federal agencies or critical infrastructure entities.

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst - SME - Air Force
Job Description:
At InnovaSystems, extraordinary solutions are born through innovative software.

A wholly owned subsidiary of Cydecor, InnovaSystems is a leading provider of information technology and enterprise-level solutions to the Department of Defense, federal, state, and local government agencies, delivering a vital service to support our nation’s National Security Strategy. We engage organizational effectiveness and readiness resulting in reduced costs, increased effectiveness, and accessibility.

As a member of the InnovaSystems team, you will be empowered to do the best work of your career with challenging assignments and collaborative teams that solve real-world problems.




Some of our perks & benefits include:

Flexible schedule & telecommute options, continuous learning opportunities including technical training and Leadership development programs, comprehensive benefits package, onsite gym/workout facilities, 401k plan w/ company match, competitive salary and a fantastic culture of collaboration.

Successful applicants will be asked to show proof of their U.S. Citizenship.



Job Role:

Force readiness reporting objectives for FY23 and beyond. This includes helping to shape policy, forecast readiness shortfalls, and generate future requirements to address CSAF and SECDEF reporting requirements.

We are looking for someone with specialized knowledge in reporting compliance, policy, and relevant leadership at Headquarters Air Force (A3TR). The successful candidate will provide guidance and actively participate in requirements reviews and user workshops. You will also research and capture business needs and act as a proxy for the users and customers by interfacing directly with developers, subject matter experts, stakeholders, and testers to ensure the end-state functionality is acceptable in fulfilling the identified customer value. On the data side, you will work with appropriate organizations to identify relevant data sources as the primary liaison for Memorandums of Understanding/Memorandum of Agreement.

As a key member of the team, you will be required to analyze data for inconsistencies such as missing/bad data, and support complex queries from data source partners or customers. Finally, you will coordinate with the DoD customer to communicate product status and alignment to the organization's needs. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are considered necessary, as you will regularly meet with senior military officers involved in plans, policy, training management, and readiness assessment.




Skills Required

5 years experience as subject matter expert working with Air Force readiness and readiness reporting. Must be familiar with policy, directives, and current top task items.

SPECIAL SKILLS OR TRAINING:

Effective written and oral communication skills a must
Ability to train readiness at multiple levels: leadership, MAJCOMs, Wings, Unit Commanders, Unit Admins, etc.
Ability to communicate with customers, stakeholders, and an agile software development team
Proficiency in MS Office Suite a must
Strong organizational, time management, and meeting facilitation skills



Skills Desired

10+ years of US Air Force experience is desired
Knowledge of METL/SORTS readiness reporting policy
Expertise in current readiness reporting (to include UTC reporting) efforts strongly recommended



Due to the nature of our business, the candidate must hold an Active DoD issued Secret Security Clearance upon hire.




Our comprehensive employee benefits offerings include:

Flexible schedule
Company-paid employee development learning and licenses
10 paid holidays
3 weeks (120 hours) of paid leave annually - hours increase after 3 years of service
5% 401k plan w/ company match
Comprehensive benefit package to include health, dental, vision, pet and supplemental insurance plans
Recognition & reward programs including peer-to-peer, service awards, leadership and values awards
Onsite offices with fitness facilities (depending on location)
Social events

InnovaSystems is a proud supporter of community organizations including; Challenged Athletes Foundation (CAF), Support the Enlisted Program (STEP), and Salvation Army

InnovaSystems International is an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V.

Title: HR Technology Support Analyst

State Role Title: HR Analyst

Hiring Range: Commensurate with experience

Pay Band: UG

Agency: Supreme Court

Location: Supreme Court of Virginia

Agency Website: www.vacourts.gov

Recruitment Type: General Public - G

Job Duties

We are looking for a Human Resources Technology Support Analyst to join the Human Resources team and assist with optimizing the workflows within the current HR applications. The responsibilities include gathering data, improving workflow performance of various Human Resource Information System (HRIS) functions and processes, and making recommendations to improve HR interaction across departments. This position fulfills liaison duties between HR and the Department of Judicial Information Technology (DJIT) to provide direct interaction on HRIS applications and technical issues. This is an on-site position.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
 Coordinates with IT and HR teams to analyze all HRIS application requirements
 Develops and implements various HRIS procedures and prepares customized reports
 Designs and executes custom ad hoc reports when necessary using Crystal Reporting and other report tools 
Monitors HRIS applications and maintains integrity of all data
 Provides efficient feedback to all system enhancements and provides training when necessary for all system and application processes
 Assists with problem resolution for production issues
 Assists DJIT in gathering requirements for changes and participates in all application solutions
 Provides application support to all HRIS reports
 Develops and implements new processes and systems for efficient HR management
 Performs statistical analysis on gathered HRIS data 
Performs audits on HR processes, data and documents, when required
 Keeps track of technological advancements and trends in the field of HRIS
 Performs other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications

 Proven work experience as a technical business analyst (two-year minimum) 
Experience with Oracle/Peoplesoft applications 
Demonstrated experience with Crystal Reports 
Proven experience in all Microsoft Office applications, specifically SharePoint
 Proven work experience as an HRIS Analyst or similar role
 Experience in analyzing HRIS and HR performance metrics
 Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including documentation
 Relevant training and/or certifications as an HRIS Analyst

Additional Considerations

 Experience with JIRA project and change management tools

Special Instructions

You will be provided a confirmation of receipt when your application and/or résumé is submitted successfully. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.




Contact Information

Name: Curt Crostic

Manager, Product Management- SimCorp Implementation

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of more elegant and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? You have to ask yourself...do you feel like making an impact?

In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas:

Human Centered

You’ll lead sourcing and synthesis of customer discovery efforts to understand customer needs to drive the long term vision for your product

You’ll turn these customer insights into actionable strategies that will define the priorities for your team and rally your stakeholders to your vision

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the long-term (12-18 months) product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, working closely with a cross-functional team to ensure that all the right resources are aligned to ensure that and your team will be successful

You’ll define KPIs for your product and will be responsible for measuring and tracking to those measures, with an eye to adjusting and refining your roadmap as the data dictates

Technology Driven

You’ll have an end-to-end understanding of your product and how it fits into the larger ecosystem to be able to anticipate impacts from changes in other parts of the business

You’ll work closely with tech leadership and architecture to understand the tradeoffs of technical decisions and how they impact the ultimately customer experience your team will deliver always looking to ensure you’re using the best tool for the job

Integrated Problem Solving

Develop and champion a bold vision that drives meaningful outcomes by embracing the art of the possible

Build frameworks for complex decision making that enable effective debate and accelerate getting to the right answer

Transformational Leadership

You’ll rally your teams and senior stakeholders to your product vision and proactively leverage relationships throughout the ecosystem to align to your vision and influence prioritization across partner teams

You’ll be responsible for attracting and retaining top talent to your team and mentoring and developing associates on their product career

As part of the SimCorp Product Manager, you’ll have access to:

Responsible for requirements & prioritization to ensure alignment with project goals and customer needs. Additionally, responsible for identifying opportunities across the entire Finance ecosystem to remediate anti-patterns, adhere to Enterprise Data Standardization, and minimize duplication (e.g., aggregation logic, reports etc.)

Identifies, defines, and socializes all configuration, methodology, and data variances with all impacted teams. Gathers requirements, risks, impacts, and considerations with those impacted teams to inform the way Tech/Data develops solutions.

Responsible for decisions, prioritization, and trade-offs across workstreams.

Spearhead critical cross-functional problem solving, influencing executives and stakeholders with data and analysis to get to timely decisions

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneering and leading cloud provider, providing virtualized infrastructure, storage, networking, messaging, and many other services to customers all over the world. AWS runs a globally distributed environment, operating at massive levels of scale. Businesses, educational institutions and governments depend on AWS for secure cloud services and solutions.

The AWS Worldwide Public Sector (WWPS) Shared Services and Business Operations, Business Planning team is seeking an innovative and talented Business Operations Analyst to play a critical role on our Workforce Planning Programs team. This team serves as an essential point of coordination between the WWPS sales teams, finance teams, and operations organizations. The team’s analysis plays an important role as we work to ensure our workforce is operating at full capacity and is taking proactive action to ensure we stay aligned to monthly headcount plans.
Data analysis is at the core of Amazon’s culture, and your work will have a direct impact on workforce decision-making and strategy for our organization. Close partnership with leaders and organizations outside of your immediate team will be necessary, as you will compile data and present information that will influence decisions across our teams. The ideal candidate will have excellent business and data analysis skills, workforce planning skills, strong business acumen and judgement (preferably in a global sales environment), intense curiosity, and effective written and verbal communication skills, along with a passion for customer service and pursuing operational excellence.

Inclusive Culture.
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Harmony. Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship and Career Growth. Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This role will sit in our new headquarters in Northern Virginia, where Amazon will invest $2.5 billion dollars, occupy 4 million square feet of energy efficient office space, and create at least 25,000 new full-time jobs. Our employees and the neighboring community will also benefit from the associated investments from the Commonwealth including infrastructure updates, public transportation improvements, and new access to Reagan National Airport.

By working together on behalf of our customers, we are building the future one innovative product, service, and idea at a time. Are you ready to embrace the challenge? Come build the future with us.

Key job responsibilities


Executing the headcount management and workforce planning (WFP) strategy, operations and reporting for an assigned business and population
Conduct workforce planning reviews and track actions to drive results and exceed KPIs
Implement, and govern key result area monitoring for workforce planning initiatives.
Educate teams and consult on WFP disciplines, expectations, and best practices for managing headcount in source systems of record
Solve ambiguous problems and proactively identify and mitigate risks (before they become issues impacting quality or timeliness of WFP actions)
Work autonomously to understand business problems, improve data quality, identify automation limitations (and improvement opportunities), scaling factors, WFP drivers, and rationale behind workforce decisions
Document and develop improvements in WFP processes, automation, integration and reporting to improve overall self-service, and improve the overall customer experience and results.
Extract, transform and load (ETL) data for the express purpose of forecasting headcount requirements in an enduring process to reach and maintain staffing levels required to support the WWPS mission.

The Business Data Analyst will work as part of the Analytics and Decision Support department. The primary purpose of this position will be to enable the University through data and information for improved decision making. This position will work closely with other business data analysts to develop technical requirements and comprehensive solutions to extract and transform data from multiple source systems for business use. The ideal candidate will understand the importance of balancing customer requirements/feedback while also performing data analysis using various tools and techniques.


Essential Functions and Responsibilities

1. Analyze and advise management of workflow issues and data integrity problems and offer recommendations on resolution. Document business process, research best practices and support development of solutions for current business operations. Develop actionable recommendations to department and business units.

2. Understands University systems and data sets. Able to summarize and describe raw data sets for departmental consumption. S upports validation processes that profile data attributes against their intended meaning.

3. Performs analysis of data that aligns to organizational goals and relays business impacts of findings through sound data driven recommendations. Operationalizes key findings, insights, and recommendations. Develops tools to speed and automate the production of dashboards, complex models, and analyses.

4. Works closely with the business units with a high degree of customer service and provides input on functional business topics. Uses critical thinking to triage escalated issues and provide customer focused service delivery.

5. Assists the business unit in streamlining business processes using new or current technology, including form and reporting development. Contribute to internal development and publication standards.

6. Provides operational support to assigned business units systems, including assistance with technical issues. Takes ownership of systems that are supported by their team.

7. Provides regular updates to customers on business process improvement and new technology activities. Supports training, communication, and development of new policies.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This position may directly or indirectly supervise other employees.

Qualifications, Credentials, and Competencies

A bachelor's degree, 1-2 years' SQL experience, as well as Excel, Access, report writing tools (Argos, SSRS, Tableau) experience required. Must also have experience with testing and maintaining core enterprise systems to ensure they are meeting operational needs and optimizing business processes. Effective communication both verbally and in writing. Ability to intuitively reason, analyze information and events, and apply judgment in order to solve problems of both a routine and complex nature. Excellent computer and organizational skills. Proof of a valid Virginia driver’s license, an acceptable DMV record, and liability insurance is required.

Pay rate range - $38/hr. to $40/hr. on W2

Title: Business Analysis Office (BAO) Manager #W2293

State Role Title: Info Technology Specialist III

Hiring Range: $85,000 - $130,000 per year (salary commensurate with experience)

Pay Band: 6

Agency: Department of Social Services

Location: DSS HOME OFFICE

Agency Website: https://www.dss.virginia.gov/

Recruitment Type: Agency Employee Only - A

Job Duties

The Business Analysis Office (BAO) Manager manages a team of Business Analysts tasked with supporting the agency’s business function across multiple Portfolios. The key role of the Business Analysis function is to bridge the gap between IT and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders. BAs engage with business leaders and users to understand how data-driven changes to process, products, services, software and hardware can improve efficiencies and add value. They must articulate those ideas but also balance them against what’s technologically feasible and financially and functionally reasonable.

The BAO Manager oversees all activities of the BAO including but not limited to BAO organizational structures, BA planning activities, development of BA guidelines, procedures, and methodologies, BA resourcing of projects, and selection and use of BA software tools for use across all agency Portfolios. The BAO Manager uses the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) as outlined by the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) to promote, implement, and enforce BA best practices and process improvement across the agency.

This position focuses on:

IT Business Analysis Team Leadership: Accountable for the team’s day-to-day functions and resources.
Methodology Development: Accountable for designing the methods IT Business Analysts use to develop business requirements in a given project.
Stakeholder Communication: Represent the IT Business Analysis team within the broader IT function and within the organization as a whole.
Ensure that all client deliverables meet the organization’s quality standards.
Facilitate the establishment of team structure and roles, hiring and on-boarding Analysts and ensuring adequate resource and talent allocation.
Manage the annual team budget.
Manage employee/team performance by setting objectives and performance metrics and standards and conducting performance reviews.
Manage escalated BA-related issues.
Participate in planning and developing agency-wide IT strategies.
Engage with key business and IT stakeholders to identify changing business priorities and requirements and introduce new processes and technology to enhance the Business Analysis service offering.
Lead the development of feasibility studies, cost/benefit analyses, business case development, risk assessments, and functional requirements for various technology projects.
Lead development of statements of work needed to procure IT systems.
Serve as an agent of change, using a disciplined approach for introducing and managing change to the agency.

The BAO Manager works closely with the Division Director, Leadership, and agency staff to support agency goals, objectives, and strategies. The BAO Manager also interfaces as needed with the VDSS Commissioner and other members of the agency Executive Team, including the Chief Deputy Commissioner and all Deputy Commissioners. In addition to these major areas of responsibilities, the BAO Manager will support other management duties as assigned and will provide direct support to the agency.



Minimum Qualifications

Extensive knowledge of the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) as outlined by the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA)
Extensive experience in Business Analysis functions to include Business Analysis Planning & Monitoring, Elicitation & Collaboration, Requirements Lifecycle Management, Strategy Analysis, Requirements Analysis & Design Definition, and Solution Evaluation.
Experience in managing a Business Analysis Office or team of Business Analysts for a large organization
Leadership experience in leading change, driving results, building coalition, and leading people.
Strong commitment to customer service and support

KSA’s and/or Competencies required to successfully perform the work:

1. Leading Change - The incumbent is a dedicated change agent and has the inherent ability to support innovation and organizational changes needed to improve the organization’s effectiveness, by initiating, sponsoring and implementing them.

2. Technical and Functional Expertise – The incumbent will possess knowledge of the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) as outlined by the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA)

3. Build Coalitions and Know the Business – The incumbent recognizes the interests of others in different parts of the organization and establishes alliances to achieve business goals. The incumbent proactively establishes recurring communications with customers using various forums including email, blogs, video conferences, recorded videos, and other means to ensure customers are aware of BA functions and support activities.

4. Drive for Results – With little direction, the incumbent will be extremely proactive in identifying, assessing, detecting, alerting, and resolving BA-related issues as they occur. The incumbent has a “can-do” approach to all matters and takes the initiative to take control and resolve customer issues as they occur. This includes contacting and coordinating with any staff or managers as needed, and immediately escalating issues as appropriate.

5. Customer Service – The BAO Manager is dedicated to customer service and has a deep commitment to supporting all customers. The incumbent will be extremely proactive in communicating with all customers in various forums and media, and will follow through in resolving issues. When necessary, the incumbent will escalate concerns to the appropriate management level.

6. Interpersonal Communication – The incumbent has excellent communications skills in a variety of forums including written, verbal, and video communications.

7. Leadership – The incumbent is a leader across the agency and is extremely proficient in leading, mentoring, and training staff on all aspects of service operations. The incumbent organizes tasks, consolidates status reports, independently solves problems, and translates technical data into executive summaries for executive staff

8. Personal Effectiveness – The incumbent is highly effective in leading a variety of work efforts, assigning critical tasks, and balancing competing priorities


Additional Considerations

The BAO Manager is well versed in the VDSS mission and various portfolios including Human Services, State Programs, Strategy & Engagement, Administration, Employee & Organizational Strategy, and IT Services.
The BAO manager will also be familiar with the functions of the VDSS Commissioner’s Office including Compliance, Legislative & Regulatory Affairs, and Public Affairs
Certification: Certification of Capability in Business Analysis (CCBA) and/or Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)
Certification: IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Foundation

Description

Financial Operations Analyst

Location: This position will work onsite at the Richmond, VA location. The ideal candidate will live within 50 miles of the Richmond, VA PulsePoint.

The Financial Operations Analyst is responsible for completing financial activities for the purpose of accurate and timely reporting both internally and externally. Assists in the development of technical solutions to complex business issues by creating spreadsheets to be utilized by lower-level positions. Maintains performance management reporting. Supports accurate balance sheet/P&L reporting. Focus is more experienced, tactical, transactional (exceptions transactions) based job.

How You Will Make An Impact:

Performs tactical data analysis and may assist Analysts with moderately complex data analysis.
Communicate exception items with all relevant areas to ensure the accuracy of data on an ongoing basis.
Provides tactical recommendations based on analysis of the data, business situation, and moderate knowledge of systems.
Receives and responds to escalated customer inquiries.
May contact management in operations, sales compensation, and sales.
Works with processors regarding enrollment/billing issues.
Acts as liaison with the bank regarding premium collection status.
Coordinates activities and provides training for lower-level associates.
Assists with system testing of IT-related projects and the implementation of application software releases within the Finance organization.

HOURS: 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. ET

Requires an Associate of Arts or Associate of Science degree in accounting or finance.
Requires experience with relational databases, mainframe, and client-server report writers; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.

Preferred Skills, Experience, Qualifications :

Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree is strongly preferred.
Previous experience in a finance/health insurance field capacity is strongly preferred.

ABOUT US AND ABOUT YOU

Clinician Nexus enables health care organizations to build thriving clinician teams with industry-leading technology products, workforce and compensation analytics, and automated workflow solutions. Backed by extensive technical expertise and industry-leading data, we deliver innovative approaches to help clients to plan, educate, and engage their clinical workforce at every stage of the lifecycle. We are committed to providing our clients with outstanding guidance and support as they focus on shaping the future of health care.

The Business Systems Analyst sits within Clinician Nexus Customer Success. In this role, you will assist in analyzing client business requirements for the product, recommending automated system controls, and testing/validating product functionality.

PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES


Helping to determine operational objectives, gather information, and evaluate output requirements.
Working closely with end-users (internal and external) to analyze, define, model, and document system requirements.
Assisting with identifying project milestones, phases and elements, while also keeping the team on time and within budget.
Constructing workflow charts and diagrams, studying system capabilities, and writing specifications.
Building client-specific rules within product, testing data, and validating results.
Assisting with creating end-user documentation (e.g., user guides, process flow charts, training materials, etc.) and delivering training.
Providing client support.
Participating in and leading product and report releases.
Position requires on-call and some weekend and after-hours commitment

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Bachelor's degree in data analytics, statistics, or related field.
Knowledge of the health care industry and/or finance is preferred.
A minimum of one year of experience with gathering systems' requirements and analyzing data is required.
Solid technical knowledge and experience working with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.

BEHAVIORAL ATTRIBUTES

Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language and respond to client and/or survey respondent inquiries.
Self-starter with demonstrated ability to successfully assist with complex project deliverables in a very driven and dynamic organization.
Demonstrated ownership of assigned tasks and dedication and perseverance to get the job done.
Flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to work under tight deadlines or changing needs.
Confidence and ability to work independently.
Exceptional employee service orientation.
Strong attention to detail.
High level of self-motivation.

Business Analyst - Billing Systems
Job Description
CoStar Group Company Intro: CoStar Group (NASDAQ: CSGP) is a leading global provider of commercial and residential real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Included in the S&P 500 Index and the NASDAQ 100, CoStar Group is on a mission to digitize the world’s real estate, empowering all people to discover properties, insights and connections that improve their businesses and lives. We have been living and breathing the world of real estate information and online marketplaces for over 35 years, giving us the perspective to create truly unique and valuable offerings to our customers. We’ve continually refined, transformed and perfected our approach to our business, creating a language that has become standard in our industry, for our customers, and even our competitors. We continue that effort today and are always working to improve and drive innovation. This is how we deliver for our customers, our employees, and investors. By equipping the brightest minds with the best resources available, we provide an invaluable edge in real estate. Role Description: The CoStar Finance department is looking for a Business Analyst, Billing Operations who will perform critical data analysis and process support related to billing and contracts on a daily and monthly basis. This individual will work on the Billing Operations team, providing structured data, quantitative insights, and project leadership to drive business results. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working with internal and external partners to gather process requirements and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic organization. Responsibilities: Contract review and validation for completeness Research and resolve complex pricing issues. Develop, create, and run data-driven processes in support of billing and contract operations. Design QC queries and lead daily QA process for assigned portfolio. Track KPIs, develop dashboards and present metrics. Identify billing process deficiencies and develop corrective action plans. Effectively lead available resources and Billing Specialists; provide direction, prioritization and allocate billing workload to bring issues to completion. Develop, audit, and improve process documentation around new and existing billing/contract process. Create user guides for internal partners. Promote a data-driven organization and empower teams with actionable data and with automated and intuitive, reliable reports and KPI dashboards. Create data sets in SQL from existing company applications and/or ETL scripts to optimize billing process. Liaise with internal technology team and external third-party providers to identify and troubleshoot system bugs while optimizing process efficiency opportunities. Lead and build ad hoc reporting requests; aid in user acceptance testing as required. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, computer science, or related from an accredited, not-for-profit University or College A track record of commitment to prior employers. 2+ years’ experience in systems support for billing, AR and/or finance department within large dynamic corporate environment. Strong technical aptitude with the ability to analyze data, interpret information and trends in large amounts of data to develop actionable recommendations. Strong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail Preferred Qualifications: Organized thinker and excellent communicator, verbal and in writing – customer service focused with a history of working successfully with both financial and non-finance professionals. An analytical business background, problem-solving skills, strategic thinking, and high attention to detail Able to prioritize effectively, and to balance multiple projects and daily/weekly process expectations with concurrent deadlines. Hands on experience using BI platforms & data warehouse tools, e.g.: Power BI, SQL Proficiency writing and working with SQL scripts and MS Access processes, advanced skills manipulating and preparing data in Excel. Ability to train colleagues to write basic SQL scripts+ Experience with Oracle What’s in it for you? When you join CoStar Group, you’ll experience a collaborative and innovative culture working alongside the best and brightest to empower our people and customers to succeed. We offer you generous compensation and performance-based incentives. CoStar Group also invests in your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Virtual and in-person mental health counseling services for individuals and family Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent) Access to CoStar Group’s Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Employee Resource Groups Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar Group is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. #LI-SM8
CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

Our exceptionally talented team is highly collaborative in spirit and practice, producing Results that Matter. Come work with the best! The Industry and Security Analysis Group (ISAG) supports a range of customer organizations with the Office of the Secretary of Defense. ISAG has a near-term opening for an experienced Foreign Investment Business Intelligence Analyst. This position will be onsite in Arlington, VA or the Mark Center in Alexandria, VA.
Responsibilities:
The Business Intelligence Analyst will provide business intelligence, economic, and market analysis in support of DoD initiatives. The candidate will integrate subject matter expertise and market analysis, leveraging business intelligence tools to connect large diverse data sources from government, commercial and open sources, to empower decisions that ensure robust, innovative, affordable, and technologically superior defense industrial capabilities today and in the future. The candidate will support ASD IBP in the identification, analysis, and tracking of foreign investments in the Defense Industrial Base (DIB). In addition, the candidate will help track foreign investment risk and deliver recommendations to the government client on how to best address that risk. The candidate shall also develop and maintain standard procedures for identifying, analyzing, and tracking foreign investment in the DIB.
Qualifications:
Required:
Bachelor's degree in the areas of Business, Finance, or Economics (or related)
5+ years of experience in global markets, industry/sector trends, capital formation, banking or intelligence analysis
Ability to research complex economic topics on short notice and to develop concise, informative products for senior leaders
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Top Secret clearance

Desired:
Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or Economics
Military or commercial business intelligence experience
Active TS/SCI

What You Will Do:

Our consultants focusing on data science and analytics help clients maximize the value of their data. These high performing individuals works with clients to implement the full spectrum of data analytics and data science services, from data querying and wrangling to data engineering, to data visualization, dashboarding, and business intelligence (BI), to predictive analytics, machine learning (ML), and artificial intelligence (AI). Our services enable our clients to define their information strategy, enable mission critical insights and data-driven decision making, reduce cost and complexity, increase trust, and improve operational effectiveness.

Provide the full spectrum of data science services to support the mission of National Security clients.
Engage clients to define requirements, elicit feedback, and communicate results.
Collaborate with other data science and analytics professionals across our Defense & Security segment and provide data science / data analytics / business intelligence services on cross-functional teams delivering other consulting services as well.
Focus on client services, while also supporting business development, internal firm initiatives, and ongoing professional development in data science, analytics, and consulting.
Analyze large and complex datasets (structured and unstructured), with a strong aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis.
Query and join data using SQL.
Wrangle, clean, and analyze data using Python or R.
Develop advanced dashboards using Tableau, demonstrating data visualization and business intelligence (BI) best practices.
Uphold strong data management.
Write technical process documentation.
Communicate/present ideas, methods, and results to clients, and explain technical topics to non-technical audiences.
Identify and address client needs, build strong client relationships, and driving initiatives forward.
Support business development including RFP, RFQ, and RFI responses and white papers.
Operate successfully on remote projects as well as hybrid on-site projects in the DC metro area.

An ACTIVE and CURRENT SECRET federal security clearance
Bachelor's Degree and 1+ years of relevant professional experience OR a M.S./M.A. degree in a relevant quantitative and computational discipline.
Proficiency in querying and joining data using SQL.
Proficiency in wrangling, cleaning, and analyzing data using Python or R.
Proficiency in developing advanced dashboards using Tableau.
Ability to support remote projects and hybrid on-site projects in the DC metro area.

Active Top Secret clearance.
M.S. or M.A. in a relevant quantitative and computational discipline.
2+ years of relevant professional experience.
Tableau Desktop Certification.
Experience utilizing Tableau jointly with Python or R.
Experience scraping data using Python.
Experience in machine learning model development using Python or R.
Experience supporting Federal National Security organizations.

Job Title: Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience
Job Description:
314 Main Street (21020), United States of America, Cambridge, Massachusetts

Manager, Product Manager, Machine Learning Experience

Capital One is a high-tech company, a scientific laboratory, and a nationally recognized brand all in one reaching tens of millions of consumers. We are a passionate and entrepreneurial team embracing bold ideas, fostering collaboration and delivering great experiences for our customers.

Machine learning is at the heart of our approach. Our teams provide millions of customers with individualized, real-time experiences, protection, and decisions driven by machine learning and advanced analytic capabilities. In order to further scale our efforts in this space, we are building a world class machine learning platform. This platform will enable our data scientists and machine learning engineers to take models from conception to production faster and safer than ever before. This work is core to Capital One’s mission, changing banking for good!


As a Manager, Product Manager on the Machine Learning Experience (MLX) Product team, you will be part of the Enterprise Model Platform (EMP) team to define, design, and deliver model and data monitoring tooling and corresponding user experiences for Capital One’s model developer and data science community. This team is focused on building centralized, managed capabilities that standardize monitoring for model inputs and outputs.

We are looking for someone with industry-leading machine learning skill sets and product acumen to improve the model monitoring experience for Capital One model developers and data scientists. This role represents the needs of the customer to inform our product roadmap, ensuring we deliver tools aligned with the intended business outcomes. You will be responsible for building the roadmap, determining product requirements, and partnering with tech teams to deliver machine learning tools. The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about technology and deeply empathizes with customer needs. They are comfortable in conversation with engineering teams as well as stakeholders ranging from data scientists to senior leaders.


Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop and communicate the product vision and strategy for key components of the platform.

Deeply understand the needs of model developers, data scientists, and machine learning engineers across Capital One.

Prioritize the Product Backlog to maximize business and customer outcomes.

Incorporate design thinking and analytics to inform product design.

Enable collaboration and ensure communication between teams.

Maintain a healthy backlog of work and play a critical role in many agile ceremonies.

Support the team with escalation and resolution of impediments.

Serve as the connection between customers, Capital One’s mission, and your team.


We want you if you are:

Passionate about building impactful products.

You enjoy putting yourself in the shoes of customers. Even better if you have experience doing this with internal customers.

You have expertise in, or are excited about, machine learning model development, data science, and ML Ops

You are a learner who is able to quickly get up to speed in a highly technical environment.

You are experienced working in an Agile environment.

You are a do-er who can also zoom out and think strategically.

You have excellent oral and written communication skills.

You are highly collaborative and have the ability to influence and lead.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of experience in product management or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

3+ years of experience in Agile product management
