Title: IT Service Portfolio Specialist

State Role Title: Information Technology Specialist II

Hiring Range: Up to $80,000 (Based on experience)

Pay Band: 5

Agency: VA Information Tech Agency

Location: VA Information Technologies

Agency Website: vita.virginia.gov

Recruitment Type: General Public - G

Job Duties

Do you have strong project coordination or project management skills? Are you interested in working with IT governance and portfolio management?
Do you have business analysis or data analysis experience? Do you have experience in analyzing, prioritizing, and reporting on IT projects or services?

If so, join a dynamic and innovative IT team that supports the mission and vision of Virginia IT Agency.

The Virginia IT Agency (VITA) is the Commonwealth’s consolidated information technology organization. We are a national tech leader in the public sector connecting Virginians to critical government services through information and innovation technology, IT infrastructure, cybersecurity, and governance.

We are looking for an IT Service Portfolio Specialist to join our team and support the governance and oversight of all supplier IT services for VITA. This role will be engaged in key activities related to the delivery of all enterprise services for executive branch agencies.

Job duties:
Developing and maintaining the IT service portfolio, which includes the catalog of IT services, and key performance indicators.

Facilitating the IT governance process, which involves reviewing and approving IT services, ensuring alignment with organizational strategy and objectives, and managing risks and issues.

Collaborating with IT service providers, business stakeholders, and senior management to provide portfolio analysis, reporting, and recommendations.

Implementing and improving portfolio management tools, methodologies, and best practices.

Participating in agile sprint sessions and monitoring progress of services moving through the service portfolio management lifecycle.

Providing regular reports and dashboards on the status, progress, and outcomes of the IT service portfolio, using tools such as ServiceNow, Power BI, and Excel

Identifying and recommending opportunities for improvement, innovation, and optimization of our IT service portfolio.

Minimum Qualifications

Mid-level technical skills and knowledge of information technology to include infrastructure and applications.




Project management and leadership skills, to oversee planning, executing, and monitoring of IT service portfolio projects and initiatives.




Strong business acumen and be able to align the IT service portfolio with the organization’s vision, mission, goals, and values.




Governance and oversight experience ensuring compliance with policies, processes, and procedures.




Ability to analyze, optimize, and report on data within IT service portfolio using tools such as ServiceNow, Power BI, and Excel.




Knowledge and experience with IT service management frameworks and best practices, such as ITIL or other frameworks that provide guidance on how to design, deliver, and improve IT services in a systematic and consistent way.




Ability to evaluate the performance, value, and risks of IT services and identify opportunities for improvement, consolidation, or retirement.




Strong communication, organizational, and stakeholder management skills to collaborate with various internal and external parties, such as IT service providers, business units, and customers.




Experience preparing and delivering clear and concise presentations to various audiences.




Working knowledge and experience with agile methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban




Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Additional Considerations

Certification in ITIL Foundations.




Agile certifications.



Project Management Certification (PMP).




ServiceNow or other ITSM tool (Remedy, Jira, etc.) experience.




Service Portfolio management experience.




Understanding of IT service delivery in a multi-sourcing environment.




Experience with state government, working knowledge of Virginia state agencies, their business plans, and activities.

Harbor Group Management Company is a multi-billion dollar real estate investment and property management firm. As we continue to grow, we are looking for passionate, goal oriented, creative individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit and great communication skills. Harbor Group is dedicated to outstanding customer service and providing exquisite living experience for our residents.

JOB SUMMARY:
Reporting to the Vice President of Revenue Management, the Revenue Analyst's function is to develop and manage business intelligence initiatives to provide actionable insight for all aspects of Revenue Management. These initiatives will drive topline revenue for the portfolio as well as demonstrate the department's bottom-line value to the organization. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the return of Harbor Group’s portfolio.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Support the pricing team on various portfolios, through data collection, utility analyses, amenity analyses, competitive analyses, market research analyses and presentation preparations.
Consult on and provide pricing support for manually priced lease-up and due diligence properties.
Synthesize input from multiple sources to support strategic departmental planning and development. Including:
Development and maintenance of departmental reports to track internal key performance indicators.
Calculating and analyzing revenue management ROI projections.
Conduct research and analysis to identify trends across portfolio, amenity, and competitor data sets.
Validating and ensuring the integrity of multiple data sources.
Follow and assist the Revenue Managers to ensure revenue management best practices including but not limited to amenities and competitor pricing are met.
Own the process of analyzing and reviewing property amenities at both the unit and community level to ensure all potential revenue is captured.
Provide business consulting to property management by utilizing multiple revenue management applications, MRI and multiple market data providers. This is inclusive of but not limited to pricing, system accuracy, system modifications, data-driven decisions, market analysis, assisting in performance measurement and overall systems support.
Own the process of gathering macro and micro economic research. Produce market economic reports on quarterly and ad-hoc bases. Assist with creating performance reports measuring property performance against submarket, metro area markets, and other competitors.
Be the subject matter expert with respect property amenities and competitor data.
Be the key contact for as well as train revenue managers, regional managers and business managers on amenity and competitor data best practices.
Work with the revenue managers to develop new reporting, processes, and training to further enhance the effectiveness and capabilities of the revenue management team.
QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Management, Economics or similar field required.
At least two years analyst experience in multi-family and real estate revenue management experience, preferred. Recent graduates with exceptional track records will be considered.
Strong analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills including financial analysis, statistical analysis, and business case development.
Technology skills including computer software, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Internet research; proficient in understanding and executing Pivot Tables.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to communicate and interact with personnel at all levels throughout the organization; have good interpersonal skills; have good presentation skills; team management skills, engages on difficult issues, and effectively influences non-direct reports.
Ability to travel up to 20% annually.
Able to meet changing priorities and deadlines.
Able to balance multiple tasks simultaneously, including project administration, monitoring, and execution; possess good organizational skills.
Veteran Friendly

Job Title: Senior Advisor Group – Operations in the Information Environment (Cyber Analyst)
Job Description:
Description:

Primary Location: Quantico, VA

Must be a U.S Citizen

Security Clearance: Secret - Top Secret w/SCI eligibility

Job Summary

Obsidian Solutions Group (OSG) is seeking an Operations in the Information Environment (OIE) Analyst to support the Marine Air Ground Task Force Staff Training program (MSTP), The OIE Analyst provides functional subject matter expertise to examine and assess MAGTF level organizations, identifies friction points, offer solutions, and draft procedures for improvement as an Observer, Trainer and Collector. Conduct observation by assessing MAGTF processes, reviewing operation orders and procedures. Plans, develops, coordinates, and delivers operational-level, regionally focused MAGTF relevant instruction, training and education, Supports the Brigadier General Selection Orientation Course (BGSOC) Senior-Leader Seminars, the Marine Corp University (MCU), and other service schools. Captures relevant data and processes through observation, analyzes capture information, records findings in a final after-action report and final exercise evaluation report. The mission of the MSTP is to provide MAGTF level training across the range of military operations, within the context of a Joint and/or Combined Task Force environment, to improve the warfighting skills, with the main effort of providing training and support.

Requirements:

Required Skills/Qualifications

Selected personnel will have an adjudicated TS clearance and access up to TS/SCI
Senior staff planning experience in the Joint Operations Planning Process and the Marine Corps Planning Process at the Marine Division, Wing, or MLG staff.
Experience conducting tactical and operational level Information Operations planning at the conceptual, functional, and detailed levels for service and functional component organizations, as well as joint headquarters organizations.
Experience analyzing and understanding the information environment and identifying and targeting key decision makers that IO Planners at the MEB, MEU, Division, Regiment, and Battalion levels follow.
Knowledge of, and operational experience employing Information Operations processes and procedures in support of ground combat, aviation, supporting arms, and combat service support units.
Completion of an appropriate level of professional military education such as Intermediate/Top Level School (ILS/TLS).
Knowledge of, and operational experience, with military doctrine, tactics, and command relationships at the operational command level.
Knowledge of command and control (C2) systems related to intelligence processes.
Graduate of MAGTF Operations in the information Environment Practitioner Course (MOPC).

Desired Skills/Qualifications

Senior Level – Bachelor’s Degree, 5+ Years Direct Relevant Experience
Proficiency using MS Word, Excel, Adobe, and Outlook skills.
Strong verbal, written, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills.

Physical Requirements and Work Environment

Normal Office Environment

Travel

Approximately 30-40% of the time

Obsidian Solutions Group LLC (OSG) is a fast-growing professional services firm based in Fredericksburg, VA. We create value for our customers by delivering technology-enabled & mission-oriented technical solutions that solve complex problems, protecting people, information, and assets. Our core capabilities are in providing Enterprise IT, Intelligence Analysis, Production & Development and Knowledge-Based Professional Services Solutions that enable the customer’s mission. Obsidian Solutions Group LLC is a certified 8(a), service-disabled, veteran-owned small business.

A career at Obsidian Solutions Group means you are able to put your expertise, credentials, and talents to great use working with customers in the DOD and Intelligence Community, while enjoying the excitement of working in a fast-growing organization committed to making a difference for our customers and in our community. Contribute independently and collaboratively alongside our amazing team of doers and thinkers. Obsidian Solutions Group is small enough to offer a family atmosphere yet large enough to deliver a highly competitive compensation package. We hire and retain the best in the industry, offering exceptional benefits that protect the well-being of our employees, their spouses and domestic partners, and their families.

Our corporate philosophy is centered on hiring and retaining employees with the requisite skills, professional experience, personal commitment, and ethical standards necessary to foster a culture of operational excellence necessary to surpass our customer’s expectations.

Job Description: C2 Labs, Inc. is a leading technology consulting firm specializing in Salesforce solutions and digital transformation. We are seeking a highly skilled Salesforce Business Analyst IV to join our team and play a critical role in delivering successful Salesforce projects for our clients. As a Salesforce Business Analyst IV at C2 Labs, you will collaborate with clients and stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and translate them into scalable and effective Salesforce solutions.

Requirements:

Must be a U.S. Citizen

Must live fulltime in the U.S.

Must be willing and able to travel as needed

Must be able to pass criminal background check(s)

Must be able to pass drug screening(s) including potential random tests

Responsibilities:

Collaborate closely with clients and stakeholders to understand their business requirements and translate them into actionable Salesforce solutions.

Conduct in-depth business process analysis and document current state and future state processes, identifying gaps, inefficiencies, and opportunities for improvement.

Facilitate requirement gathering sessions, workshops, and interviews to elicit business needs and define clear and concise user stories and acceptance criteria.

Translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications, ensuring alignment with Salesforce best practices and industry standards.

Work closely with development teams to ensure the accurate translation of business requirements into technical design and development.

Perform system configuration, customization, and data modeling within the Salesforce platform to meet business needs.

Conduct thorough testing and quality assurance to ensure the accuracy, performance, and usability of Salesforce solutions.

Provide ongoing support and training to end-users, addressing questions, issues, and change requests related to Salesforce functionality.

Collaborate with project managers to track project progress, manage priorities, and communicate updates to clients and stakeholders.

Stay up-to-date with the latest Salesforce releases, features, and best practices, and proactively share knowledge and insights with the team.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).

Extensive experience (7+ years) as a Business Analyst, preferably with a focus on Salesforce implementations.

Salesforce Certified Administrator or Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator certification is required.

Strong understanding of Salesforce platform capabilities, including Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Community Cloud.

Proven experience in gathering and documenting business requirements, creating user stories, and defining acceptance criteria.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business needs into clear and actionable solutions.

Solid understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies and experience working in collaborative, cross-functional teams.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients, stakeholders, and technical teams.

Experience with Salesforce data modeling, process automation, and integration patterns.

Familiarity with Salesforce Lightning Experience and declarative configuration capabilities.

Proficiency in using Salesforce tools and applications, such as Salesforce Analytics, Reports, and Dashboards.

How to Apply: If you are an experienced Salesforce Business Analyst with a passion for translating business requirements into effective Salesforce solutions, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining our team at C2 Labs, Inc.

5+ years of account management, project or program management or buying experience
Bachelor's degree
Experience driving internal cross-team collaboration
Experience using data to influence business decisions
Experience with business analysis and P&L management

Introduction
As a Package Consultant at IBM, get ready to tackle numerous mission-critical company directives. Our team takes on the challenge of designing, developing and re-engineering highly complex application components and integrating software packages using various tools. You will use a mix of consultative skills, business knowledge, and technical expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into our clients' business environment and achieve business results.

Your Role and Responsibilities

The Solution Architect is responsible for providing overall solution, set the direction and guide the team of SMEs in implementing Oracle Fusion Financials. Review and provide feedback to designs, business processes and functional and technical specifications for required reports, extensions, conversions, interfaces, and workflows. Lead Configuring Oracle Fusion financial modules including general ledger, payables, receivables, project accounting, purchasing, and federal or public sector processes etc. Lead developing use cases, test scripts, and perform testing cycles such as regression testing, integration testing and support user acceptance testing. Support development and delivery of user training and other deployment activities in the using the Oracle Fusion Applications.

The ideal candidate will have expertise in design, architect and deliver Oracle Financials and Procurement Applications

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 10 years of experience implementing and delivering Oracle Financial Applications as solution architect, functional lead, SME, and business analyst
3 plus years of experience implementing Oracle Fusion Applications as the Solution Architect / functional Lead / SME

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience implementing Oracle federal financials.
Past experience supporting federal agencies.
Experience supporting retail/re-sale accounting and financial systems.

About Business Unit
IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM
In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?


About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups, giving & volunteer opportunities, and discounts on retail products, services & experiences

What is the role?

You would be a key member of our Integration Technology Team, leading the team’s development efforts to support our existing application and developing new solutions to meet the diverse needs of a growing network of customers. You will be responsible for determining the application requirements needed to automate business processes between IntraFi and its member institutions. You will act as a liaison between functional/technical stakeholders and your development team, and you will lead the analysis on how IntraFi’s integration technology and processes can be enhanced to meet current and future business needs. You will also provide agile and project management best practices to your team and lead key agile ceremonies as a scrum master.

Your responsibilities include:

Work with top IT talent in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where automation and technical craftsmanship are a top priority.
Independently perform functional analysis for new projects, as well as document functional and system requirements and solution designs.
Facilitate meetings, manage and guide conversations with differing opinions, and communicate clearly and effectively with a variety of audiences.
Be able to operate across multiple projects simultaneously and perform a variety of tasks, from addressing production issues to soliciting functional requirements from business stakeholders.
Usher feature development from inception through release, as well as provide production support. This includes creating project charters, drafting and socializing story maps, detailing technical specifications, and crafting application roll-out strategies to ensure seamless releases.
Proactively identify and solve conflicting requirements across teams within the Integration technology domain. Be able to answer questions, provide detail, address changes to requirements, and facilitate dialog across teams.
Be a key contributor to the software development lifecycle, including ensuring that project deliverables meet or exceed IntraFi’s policies, procedures, and standards.
You should possess the following experience, skills, and qualifications:
Extensive experience with business analysis (5+ years)
Demonstrated success leading development teams within an agile framework, with experience tracking and removing impediments
Experience working in a fast-paced software development environment, leveraging continuous delivery, infrastructure as code, and automated testing
Exceptional written and oral communication skills sufficient to communicate effectively with nontechnical and technical business clients and teams
Ability to independently define requirements, acceptance criteria, and functional designs for complex IT systems
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience working in a production support environment, particularly one with rapid response requirements
Oracle PL/SQL skills preferred
Experience working with AWS technologies preferred
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, finance, or business or equivalent experience in software production or programming

5+ Years of Experience in Business Analysis & Governance.
Governance Framework Analysis: Assess and evaluate existing IT governance frameworks, methodologies, and controls. Identify gaps, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement to ensure alignment with industry standards and organizational objectives.
Policy Development and Review: Develop, update, and review IT governance policies, procedures, and guidelines in accordance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices. Ensure these policies are communicated effectively across the organization.
Compliance and Risk Management: Monitor regulatory changes and assess the impact on IT governance. Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. Conduct risk assessments and implement controls to ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations.

Salary: Up to $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

Our consultants focusing on data science and analytics help clients maximize the value of their data. The Opportunity:

Here, you’ll have the chance to work with an agile team as they develop digital products to support your clients’ most pressing missions. We’re looking for someone like you to implement business analytics and processes, as well as delve into technology trends to deliver user-friendly client experiences.

As an IT business analyst, you’ll help develop leading-edge applications and systems. Working with your team of business and IT system analysts, you’ll help identify clients’ business needs, gather user requirements, and develop user stories. You’ll learn to understand the overall direction and nuanced user needs clearly, and you’ll support your team as they fulfill these needs by creating deployable features. Together, you’ll contribute to the delivery of high business value products to our clients. Due to the nature of work performed within this facility, U.S. citizenship is required.

Work with us to make an impact by supporting the needs of our clients and the firm.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

TULK is a leading boutique consulting firm providing technology and management consulting services to the US Federal Government. Our expert team assists Defense and National Security clients in acquiring, designing, managing, and developing advanced technology systems and business practices to advance their missions. We offer tailored benefits, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, long and short-term disability, flexible work schedules, cash bonuses, access to technology, tuition reimbursement, 401k, and more.

We are looking for applicants with a broad range of skills and interests to join our team. At TULK, we carefully match our employees with assignments that best fit their unique skill sets and career goals. If you're interested in the position below, we encourage you to apply and take the next step in your career with TULK.

About the Work

The Commercial GEOINT Discovery and Assessments Office (SCD) searches out and procures the best commercial GEOINT sources for the National System for Geospatial Intelligence (NSG). SC’s mission is to coordinate and manage the discovery, assessment, procurement, and delivery of commercial GEOINT solutions for the NSG. SCD’s functions include the following:

Engaging with industry and existing NSG activities to discover commercial GEOINT solutions for assessment based on balancing customer demand, commercial market availability, and the Intelligence Community’s (IC) unique collection and analysis needs.
Coordination with NSG partners to determine NSG mission needs to determine commercial solutions, assess commercial GEOINT solutions and inform our acquisition strategies.
Coordinate assessments across NGA.
Inform functional management governance processes to ensure efficiency in discovery, assessment, and expenditure of resources.
Fortify sensor resilience through a diversity of commercial suppliers.
Determine commercial solutions having the best match to prioritized NSG needs and conducting the procurement and delivery to meet those needs.

Advise and assist with strategic planning, policy and business analysis, with a focus on providing expert strategic- and operational-level assistance with GEOINT analytic activities and resources across NGA and its stakeholders. Provide business management/strategy support. Develop strategy documentation, guidance to support management processes. Facilitate cross office engagements and requirements planning needs. Identify and provide support to business processes and improvements. Provide business analytics, metrics, or other analysis to measure success.

Your Duties

Providing expertise, guidance, consultation, facilitation, and thought leadership to the client and/or project team based on specialized in-depth expertise in such fields as: engineering and technology; policy and administration; planning; analysis; communications; business; and management.
Assessing and facilitating discoverability and accessibility of commercial GEOINT data and services.
Informing integration of new data sets across multiple classified and unclassified domains to both US Government and Allied systems. Coordinates with the NSG to integrate solutions into the GEOINT Enterprise Architecture (GEA).
Ensuring that quality is an integral part of the development, design and delivery of commercial GEOINT products or services.
Monitoring products and services throughout the life cycle; validates/verifies adherence to specified requirements through test and measurement activities; manages/leads quality assurance activities.
Working closely with assigned staff, senior specialists or task leads. May direct the activities of specialists or other staff as necessary on activities related to the specified field or discipline.
Preparing and delivering reports and briefings for senior leadership across the IC and Agency, as well as development and communication of associated messages and communication/outreach strategies.
Under the guidance of Government, acting as the interface between NGA and NSG customers and source providers.
Supporting development and enforcement of national, IC, and NGA policies and regulations governing the licensing and operation of commercially owned remote sensing systems.
Coordinating NGA and IC positions on commercial remote sensing system license requests.
Providing secretariat support to the NGA-led Commercial Remote Sensing Working Group, consisting of members from across the IC.
Providing administrative support to the chair of the IC Commercial Space Council
Reviewing and revising management and governance policies, instructions, standards, and best practices.
Developing documentation and guidance to support commercial remote sensing system license management processes.
Facilitating cross-agency and cross-office engagements, through regular meetings of working groups at senior and action officer levels, and through ad hoc engagements as needed.
Identifying and supporting business processes improvements.
Preparing and delivering reports and briefings for senior leadership across the IC and Agency, as well as development and communication of associated messages and communication/outreach strategies.
Producing written reports, presentations or other artifacts as required by the Government for each task assigned and supporting briefings and meetings to discuss recommendations.
Building productive relationships with senior leaders, the general workforce, and other collaborating partners.
Provides customer service, representational and written communication skills.

Required Skills and Experience

Top Secret SCI (TS/SCI) Security Clearance
US Citizenship
Demonstrated experience in Commercial GEOINT, including validating /verifying adherence to specified policies and regulations.
Demonstrated experience routinely interacting with senior-level personnel, including key component directors.
Demonstrated experience collaborating with teams of subject matter experts, sharing knowledge with others, and working as a team member.
Demonstrated experience advising and assisting with strategic planning and policy development, with a focus on providing expert strategic-level assistance.

Osi Vision is seeking an IT Project Manager, Subject Matter Expert (SME) who is responsible for managing the assigned projects, assigned contractor personnel, and provide IT support to the Department of Interior (DOI), Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Cyber Security Division, Identity, Credential and Access Management (ICAM) Branch which is responsible for managing the Department’s ICAM Program services to bureaus and office in support of ICAM - DOIAccess Systems. Work is located on the USGS campus in Reston, VA.

The IT Project Manager, SME ensures contractor expert-level professional services are provided to maintain and enhance the existing DOIAccess System, which is required for on-boarding all DOI personnel and is accessible Department-wide to all network users.

§ Maximum value out of limited IT budget resources.

Products and Tools.

o Develop and maintain DOIAccess training courses, updated yearly to reflect new or updated system functionality and capabilities. Upload training course into DOI’s enterprise training system DOI Talent.

o Work with the GTL and the CAB members to set/maintain project priorities.

o Software Development, Maintenance, and Enhancement.

§ Ensure minimal need for emergency/corrective maintenance.

o Software Testing – Build and maintain a testing environment to complete:

o System Documentation

o Meetings

Must have a minimum 5+ years documented (documented is defined as recorded and verifiable on the resume) experience, and have the knowledge, skills, and abilities in all the following requirements:

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Who We Are:

ContinuumCloud offers a spectrum of cloud-based software solutions intentionally designed to meet the unique needs of the behavioral health and human services industry. These solutions include an EHR platform, powered by Welligent, and an HR & Payroll system, powered by DATIS HR Cloud. Through these offerings, ContinuumCloud empowers organizations to provide high-quality care and deliver on their mission.

About the role:

ContinuumCloud, is seeking an EHR Billing Implementation Analyst who is responsible for managing the customer’s migration to Welligent EHR using the standard implementation lifecycle for assigned projects. This position is full-time remote, and can be located anywhere in the United States, but some travel may be required.

This project resource shall serve as the primary EHR Subject Matter Expert for Billing / Revenue Cycle Management related items and is responsible for identifying gaps between the software and customer contract requirements, for requirements definition, and guiding the configuration effort. The Implementation Analyst is responsible for providing solutions that support migration of customer’s current state to future state functionality in Welligent EHR software through direct interaction with end-users and customer leadership.

As part of Welligent EHR Implementation Department, Implementation Analyst is responsible for customer discovery, business analysis, configuration, and successful knowledge transfer for Welligent EHR Implementations. Working with the Welligent EHR project managers; communicate deficiencies, request escalation, define customer weaknesses, and provide status information to deliver projects according to plan. For all customer-facing meetings, including application demonstrations and training, provide detailed agendas and worksheets to the customer with time for review prior to meetings. The EHR Billing Implementation Analyst will be assigned to lead customer implementations of small to medium size and complexity. The Implementation Analyst is expected to become proficient in Welligent EHR software/services with a substantial working knowledge within 3 months.





This salary range may include multiple levels. Your level is based on our assessment of your interview performance and experience, which you can always ask the hiring manager about to understand in more detail. Salary is just one component of ContinuumCloud's total compensation package for employees. Your total rewards package at ContinuumCloud will include top-notch medical, dental and vision coverage, student loan reimbursement, a Flexible PTO policy, and many other benefits.


ContinuumCloud's salary range for this position


$65,000—$75,000 USD

Requirements

How you’ll make an impact:

Manage the Billing / Revenue Cycle Management needs of multiple Welligent EHR software implementations
Following implementation process and procedures, responsible for the efficient and successful implementation of all assigned customer projects
Responsible for the customer success and satisfaction with the Welligent EHR implementation process
Responsible for the review of customer’s current state to establish change management and business process re-engineering path that supports migration to future state in Welligent EHR software using standard functionality and best practices where possible
Responsible for personal time management and documenting individual direct and indirect time and activities for projects using project management systems, currently Salesforce
Responsible for working with the project manager on project activity reporting including regular status reporting on assigned customer projects
Through both provided training and independent learning, responsible for staying current on all EHR software products and functionality at a detailed level
Establish and maintain quality relationships with Welligent EHR customers and all Welligent departments to support achieving the Implementation Team’s goal to successfully implement customers in a reasonable and achievable timeline
Independently identify and escalate quality improvement opportunities related to the software implementation process, documentation, software functionality
Deliver onsite customer training and knowledge transfer throughout the implementation

What You Bring to the Role:

Requirements

3+ years of EHR/EMR software implementation experience (5+ years preferred)
Bachelor’s degree preferred (or equivalent years relevant experience)
EHR Software training experience required
Knowledge of Welligent software a plus
Significant EHR software implementation project experience with participation in meeting objectives, goals, and commitments
Excellent analytical, planning, and organizational skills, ability to work on multiple tasks/projects simultaneously
Strong interpersonal skills including collaboration, and team participation
Ability to maintain a balance between independently owning decisions and accommodating stakeholders
Excellent communication and written skills utilizing various media and methods for communication
Experience with business productivity software (i.e. Microsoft Office suite)
Project Management and CRM software tools (i.e. MS Project) experience a plus
Behavioral Health Industry background preferred
Up to 25% travel may be required, must be flexible prepared if ever returned

Benefits

We care about the health and well-being of our team. We provide a comprehensive benefits package including:



Multiple medical insurance options including a 100% employer-paid plan
401k plan with company match
Company-funded Life, AD&D, and Disability Insurances
Company-sponsored training and certification programs
Open PTO program
Company holidays include New Year’s Day, Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, the Friday after Thanksgiving, Christmas Day, and 2 Floating Holidays
Parental Leave
Perks in our offices include paid parking, an on-site gym, catered lunches, and healthy snacks

Role Summary

MetaPhase is seeking a Senior Technical Writer with ten or more (10+) years of experience to be a part of a federal customer engagement team supporting cybersecurity strategy, business requirements and analysis, and process improvement. This team will work closely with senior federal leadership to distill national cybersecurity mission requirements, identify gaps in current services, and draft strategic documents outlining future activities, ensuring they closely align with national cybersecurity plans. This position requires an ability to work well with senior leaders, produce error-free and grammatically correct deliverables, and lead junior staff in the development of other detailed strategic documents.


What You Will Be Doing

Conduct thorough quality checks on all cybersecurity documentation to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to formatting guidelines.
Produce resources for employees to promote awareness and understanding of cybersecurity policies and procedures and how the daily work supports the broader mission.
Ensure that all cybersecurity plans and documentation, including policies and strategies, align with broader national and organizational cybersecurity plans.
Generate 508 compliant documents
Work with policy document structure and content within the Federal government (DHS experience preferred)
Draft and update cybersecurity policies aligned with the current strategy, ensuring they are clear and comprehensive.




What We Need From You (Required)

Minimum of ten or more (10+) years’ experience in communications, business analysis or role that involves writing, speaking, coordination.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Possess strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
U.S. citizenship required (no exceptions); Ability to obtain and hold an active Public Trust.
Familiarity with both the Government Printing Office (GPO) and Associated Press (AP) Style Guides
Ability to quickly grasp complex concepts and make them easily understandable in text and pictures
Strong ability to quickly collate content from numerous disparate sources
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office

Bonus Points (Desired)

Federal consulting experience; Experience at DHS a strong plus

None

Arlington, VA

Minimum bachelor’s degree

Ability to obtain and hold an active Public Trust Clearance

Are you interested in making a world of difference in cancer care?
Cancer strikes more than 10 million people worldwide each year. As the leading medical society representing doctors who care for people with cancer, the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) is committed to conquering cancer through research, education, and promotion of the highest quality, equitable patient care.
Who we are:
ASCO is a flexible, high-performance membership organization where employees collaborate to support our mission through evidence, care, and impact. Together with Conquer Cancer, the ASCO Foundation and CancerLinQ colleagues, we foster a culture that prioritizes customer-centricity, emphasizes teamwork, commits to quality, and values inclusion. Our culture, ASCO Works – Our Way of Working, has long enabled workplace flexibility and embraced technology to help us achieve balance.
ASCO offers competitive salaries, an excellent benefits package, and opportunities to participate in professional development programs.
Who we are looking for:
ASCO has a new role for a Senior Manager, Business Intelligence to lead ASCO data initiatives ensuring the seamless flow of high-quality data, enabling Operations and Analytics to enhance processes, and make informed decisions. This hire will shape and deliver the strategic vision for Business Intelligence solutions that align with ASCO's broader vision and strategic goals, encompassing the establishment of BI and self-service analytics capabilities throughout the organization.

Remote candidates welcome or primary location in Alexandria, VA.
What you will do
Serve as a thought leader and advocate for industry best practices and innovative solutions in Business Intelligence and Analytics
Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies to drive continuous improvement in data-driven decision-making
Collaborate closely with Business leaders, Product Owners, and the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to formulate and execute Enterprise Analytics roadmaps that align with organizational priorities working towards achieving measurable business outcomes through strategic data initiatives
Promote and implement self-service analytic tools to end users, documenting processes and providing training as needed
Lead the development of world-class, narrative-driven, and visually rich dashboards and reporting solutions
Collaborate on the architecture design, data modeling, and implementation of the Big Data platform and analytic applications
Assist in conceptual, logical, and physical database design to meet business requirements while ensuring that data storage and retrieval mechanisms are optimized for performance and scalability
Drive end user adoption of Business Intelligence solutions by fostering data-driven decision-making with solutions are actively and effectively utilized by the business to drive performance improvements
Ensure that data and metadata are clearly defined, documented, and easily accessible; maintain comprehensive documentation to support data governance and compliance efforts
Drive organizational change initiatives in collaboration with cross-functional stakeholders, advocate for the adoption of new processes and tools that enhance data-driven decision-making and drive continuous improvement across the organization
Required Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent years of training/ experience
8-10 years of relevant experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics, Data Management, Data and Analytics architecture, implementation, and visualization providing insights to different types of customers, or a related field
Demonstrated experience working with sensitive data such as PII (Personal Identifiable Information and/or SPI (Sensitive Personal Information)
Significant experience in leading Business Intelligence and Analytics initiatives within complex organizations and up to date with current trends and best practices
Proven track record of strategic thinking and collaboration with key stakeholders to align data initiatives with organizational goals
Demonstrated proficiency in change management to drive end user adoption and facilitate organizational change
Expertise in data documentation and governance practices, and knowledge of best practices for metadata management, data quality, and data stewardship
A history of successfully designing and building enterprise-grade, scalable data solutions
Understanding of the analytics development life cycle and enterprise architecture
Expertise in data architecture, modeling, and Big Data platforms
Solid understanding of database design principles and optimization techniques to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval, supporting data-driven decision-making
Preferred Education and Experience
Relevant certifications in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or related fields (e.g., Certified Business Intelligence Professional - CBIP, Certified Data Management Professional - CDMP, etc.)
Competencies
Experience in promoting and implementing self-service analytic tools to empower end users and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, including written, to effectively convey complex data concepts to diverse audiences, including non-technical stakeholders
Self-motivated with a strong sense of accountability, urgency, and drive to proactively address data-related challenges and opportunities
Ability to use innovative problem-solving and critical thinking approaches to proactively solve a broad range of problems across business functions, and develop creative solutions to complex data challenges
Collaborative spirit with the ability to operate at both strategic and tactical levels with ability to establish direction, provide detailed guidance, deliver results, and troubleshoot
Excellent leadership skills and the ability to guide and mentor teams
ADA/Physical Requirements
Extended periods seated or standing at a desk.
High use of computer and other office technology equipment.

5-10 days/year

Job Title: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Business Analyst Washington DC Area
Job Description:
Company Description


Established in 2015, The Efficiency Group is a small, process improvement/Lean Six Sigma (LSS) training and consulting firm dedicated to helping business or government organizations improve operational performance in a practical, commonsense manner using LSS techniques. Our unique HELIX approach emphasizes understanding and working within an organization’s culture to deploy improved business processes and support business process optimization. Through our training and implementation support, The Efficiency Group is changing the paradigm of traditional Lean Six Sigma training and its utilization.

The Efficiency Group is looking to add the right people to its cadre of LSS practitioners. We want smart, hardworking, driven people who put their customers first but understand a work-life balance. We want individuals dedicated to their customers, the company, and themselves who recognize that we can grow better together when we all work together as one. We want individuals who understand and are knowledgeable in LSS tools and techniques but who also understand the limitations of a “one size fits all” approach to process improvement. We look for leaders, doers, and team players who work to make themselves better through their work, their interactions with colleagues, their leadership of projects, and their role in the community.

The Efficiency Group is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace; is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.



Job Description


This is a hybrid position located in the Washington DC area.

Provide technical support to a federal agency in streamlining its operational processes using process modeling, analysis, Lean Six Sigma and reengineering techniques, as required. Support the effort to develop guidance document development framework and guidance documentation content and maintenance to the same agency/project. Support all project management activities including project schedule development and maintenance, status meeting scheduling and leadership, task coordination, and quality assurance.

This is a senior project support position, and the successful candidate will be responsible for helping to operationally execute this project to effectively meet all project requirements and customer expectations.

Job Responsibilities

As part of a Team, support all Project Management activities including development and monitoring of a master project schedule, tracking parallel workstreams, provide strategy and support to project-related communications, leading client and task lead interactions, ensure outstanding quality to all developed materials.
Bring a positive attitude, a can-do spirit, professionalism, and the flexibility to be part of a growing successful team.
Support all BPR and process improvement activities as dictated by the project and directed by the client including but not limited to:
Developing and supporting prioritization of a process inventory
Defining process improvement project charters featuring scope, risks, SMEs, etc.
Support scheduling and executing all Kaizen event sessions
Understanding the as-is, identifying challenges and improvement opportunities, agreeing on improvement strategies for the to-be, etc.
Supporting the development of all process models using the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN)
Supporting the development, scheduling and briefing project and organizational leadership on an ongoing basis regarding individual process improvement projects, the overall effort, specific topics, etc.
Supporting development of corresponding to-be process documentation such as but not limited to a process narrative or standard operating procedure, job aids, frequently asked questions, etc.
Supporting to-be process deployment activities including the development and delivery of training, communications, and change management materials.
Support Continuous Process Improvement (CPI) efforts.
Support development of a framework process for organizational guidance document development and maintenance. Lead development of framework requirements – including appropriate corresponding processes and requirements – and support execution of framework processes.
Support maintenance of organizational guidance documentation through the conduct of content audits, pipeline development and tracking for organizational standard operating procedures and policies, manage the review and vetting process for documentation review, maintain documentation metadata, support updating/uploading to client intranet.
Support client intranet improvement efforts as related to guidance document publishing, searching, retrieving, and support improved access to developed and deployed guidance documents.
Support close coordination with other, appropriate client initiatives to ensure proper alignment and alignment, as appropriate.
Support development of an organizational content management strategy through the review and maturation of governance standards.
Support development of appropriate documentation frameworks and content standards for multiple types of documents including standard operating procedures, job aids, etc.
Work with organizational subject matter experts to develop or update guidance documents as dictated by organizational leadership. Develop the processes related to the guidance documents then develop the corresponding documentation based of the developed framework.
Coordinate the content development and updating of process by scheduling and supporting all appropriate meetings, conducting research on governance policies and regulations, and benchmarking peer organizations, preparing first draft of processes/guidance documents, coordinating and supporting the vetting and review process, developing final versions of all documents, developing appropriate change management and communications materials, supporting deployment to the client intranet, and continuously reviewing processes for efficiency and documentation for updating.
Support Job Aid development and alignment to internal client tracking system.
Actively work to intimately understand the client environment, actors, requirements, etc. and become the client’s “trusted partner” for all things process or documentation related.
Actively work to expand the project to new areas in support of meeting client needs and expectations.
Develop training materials and deliver training to organizational staff, as necessary, on developed guidance document framework.
Provide other client support, as tasked.


Qualifications

Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification
Mimimum of 3 years experience with process improvement, Lean Six Sigma, etc.
Bachelor's Degree required with a Master's preferred.
Direct experience with process improvement and understanding business process goals, systems, data, people requirements, and identifying opportunities for improvements across all aspects individually and collectively.
Experience with using LSS techniques in government/non-manufacturing enviroments requried. This is not a typcial LSS deployment and requires understanding, knowledge and expertise is deploying LSS in a government agency.
Experience developing organizational documents including procedured documentation and job aids.
Experience in interacting with client staff and leadership in the development of processes, frameworks, communications, training, and change management materials.
Experience working as a part of a team to achieve client-driven objectives and requirements.
Experience interacting with Project leadership to define project goals, objectives, purpose, and then executing on defined requirements.
Experience with SharePoint or MS Team workflow development and implementation a plus.
Experiences or knowledge in process simulations and simulations analysis a plus.
Experience or knowledge in robotic process automation (RPA) a plus.
Direct experience with developing process models in MS Visio.
Ability to commute to client site in Bethesda area required.
Hybrid work environments are supported but candidates must be located within the Washington DC, Maryland, Northern Virginia (DMV) area. Travel to customer sites is not reimbursed for hybrid employees.

Additional Information


Skills, Abilities and Behaviors

Focused on the customer, their needs, expectations and requirements.
A positive attitude, humility, and flexibility in working with others
A doer with willingness to be part of a growing team doing great work for great clients
Effective, experienced team player able to support both large and small project teams, to drive towards solutions, and engage participants in a positive way to facilitate organizational improvement.
Experience with effective communications development and delivery
Empathic and commonsense understanding of Lean Six Sigma and BPR tools and techniques, and their practical implementation within organizations resistant to change.
Able to work individually or in groups to identify customer challenges, determine strategies for meeting those strategies, developing processes implementing those strategies, and supporting to-be process adoption across an enterprise.
Excellent writing skills.
Team player ready to focus on the customer while helping The Efficiency Group and themselves grow.

Tools & Technologies

MS Office Suite
MS Visio
MS Project

Salary Range: $80K - $95K

OVERVIEW:

ANSER enhances national and homeland security by strengthening public institutions. We provide thought leadership for complex issues through independent analysis and we deliver practical, useful solutions. ANSER values collaboration, integrity, and initiative and we are client focused in all that we do. Because we were established for the purpose of public service and not for profit, we measure our success in the impact of our service.

SPECIFIC JOB DESCRIPTION:

This position is located in the Organizational and Management Policy Directorate (O&MPD) under the Director of Administration and Management (DA&M) providing support to Directorate leadership, government AOs and SMEs, and the contract team. Successful candidates will accurately distribute incoming and outgoing unclassified and classified documents, provide subject matter expertise, and carry out day-to-day activities to support the OSD mission and its most senior leaders, the Secretary and Deputy Secretary of Defense, and the Military. Specific duties will include:

Assign and manage correspondence workflow by serving as the O&MPD liaison with the DA&M front office, other DA&M Directorates, and OSD components.
Review and assign correspondence documents to the appropriate OSD offices and/or personnel for response through the Correspondence and Task Management System (CATMS).
Develop, monitor, update, implement, and maintain an internal suspense tracking system for correspondence, memos, letters and other documents and projects received.
Prepare metrics, weekly action reports of critical suspense data, weekly reconciliation between internal/external program offices of pending/overdue actions, and identify discrepancies to government personnel.
Provide guidance for managing the correspondence of the Secretary and Deputy Secretary of Defense and Executive Secretary of the Department of Defense as well as OSD and DoD Component correspondence in accordance with the official DoD correspondence guidance, "DoD 5110.4-M Vol 1 DoD Manual for Written Material: Correspondence Management and DoD 5110.4-M Vol 2 DoD Manual for Written Material: Examples and Reference Material”.
Assist government personnel with the development of business methods and procedures, including administrative systems, file systems, office systems, process flows, and production schedules to support CATMS.
Create and implement training guides and support training of staff members in the structure and missions of the DA&M, OSD and the Components, CATMS, and proper preparation of signature packages, and using the correspondence guidance and suspense tracking system.
Operational duties related to Organizational and Management DoD briefing resources preparation, Office of Legislative Counsel Green Sheet support assignment and tracking, human resources, IT, security, facilities management:
Answering and routing phone calls and greeting/escorting guests,
In-processing new personnel (DD1172; DD2249; DD2875),
Requesting and managing all equipment and furniture inventory,
Suite access, SCIF maintenance, and burn bag destruction,
Resolution of IT and network issues, and
Ordering/maintaining supplies
Other responsibilities and duties as assigned

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree plus at least 4 years’ relevant professional experience.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Requirements:

Secret clearance required at date of hire
The ability to provide on-site support at least 3 days a week, until client on-site requirements resume full-time on-site support 5 days a week.
The ability to support a rotating shift coverage schedule is a firm requirements with the early shift from 7:00 am – 3:30 pm and later shift from 8:30 am – 5:00 pm.
Experience working correspondence management, task assignment and tracking, or Executive Secretariat-like functions in the U.S. government.
Experience with CATMS and "DoD Manual for Written Material: Examples and Reference Material” (DoDM 5110.04)
Prior experience working with and/or supporting senior-level officials and knowledge of the structure and missions of the OSD and the Components.
High level of proficiency of the English language, both written and oral.
Highly proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite of applications, especially Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams.
Energetic and the capability to work in a fast-paced team environment, adapt to rapidly changing requirements, and multi-task capabilities.
Ability to produce quality work independently or in a group setting, provide solutions to customer issues, and solve problems quickly.

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendment Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position with ANSER, please call 703-416-2000 or e-mail Recruiting@anser.org.

ANALYGENCE supports HQ ACC Flight Operations Division (A3T) with combat readiness and training of the Combat Air Forces. Support includes technical and subject matter expertise to develop and oversee policy for ACC flight operations, aircrew flying training, mission operations, and formal training programs.




This position will advise and assist A3 to plan, organize, and determine necessary policies, regulations, directives, programs, doctrine, and procedures for the establishment and maintenance of assigned major command programs.




Draft classified and unclassified briefing slides for A3, with coordination between members of A3's 10 Divisions and two Squadrons, with as little as 2-hours of preparation time. Briefing preparation will focus on content, operational focus, format, presentation, professionalism, and accuracy.
Coordinate training and readiness issues with Headquarters Air Force (HAF), 22 ACC Wings, three Numbered Air Forces (NAFs), the USAF Warfare Center and various Field Operating Agencies under the NAF umbrellas.
Develop executive-level decision support materials for A3 and prepare position papers, staff summary packages, power point presentations, charts, bullet background papers, etc., to ensure the strategic vision of A3 is properly articulated to target audiences and into actionable tasks.
Assist with coordination and planning of A3T hosted conferences (approximately four annually), review boards, telecoms, (S)VTCs and meetings to include staff briefing preparation, assistance with event logistics (billeting, protocol liaison, facilities liaison, etc.) directly supporting A3 and his staff.
Prepare and track branch taskings, consolidate required information, and schedule and adjust taskings based on manning, experience, training and abilities.
Analyze taskings, procedures, practices, and resources for the A3 directorate to be able to effectively and efficiently resolve operational challenges and issues to help ensure successful mission accomplishment.
Assist in drafting aircrew or aircraft training device policy and standards for safe operations of a variety of aircraft assigned to the Command; plan, coordinate, and assist in the implementation of operational plan (OPLAN) tasking; and develop long-range planning for the acquisition of advanced weapon systems to support command missions.
Assist in the generation and maintenance of unit Design Operational Capability (DOC) statements in accordance with governing directives.
Develop, modify, maintain, and/or eliminate validated combat aircrew training requirements via the RAP for Government consideration. Draft consolidated unit RAP and other periodic reporting into decision quality products for senior leader review, direction, and guidance.
Draft CAF formal flying training requirements and coordinate the allocation of training resources between MAJCOMs, components, and other end users.
Assist in creating or updating AF Instructions including Major Weapon System (MWS) specific training and operational guidance.
Draft analysis to support A3 strategic planning and execution teams on specific issues, quick look studies and provide analysis of force structure and operational issues directly impacting ACC and CAF operations worldwide.
Assist in analyzing unit and MWS readiness reports for operational and programmatic trends, shortfalls or disconnects. Advise leadership on readiness issues which may affect AF support to Combatant Commanders (COCOMs). Assist in the execution of CAF Readiness Reviews, CAF Formal Training Reviews, and Training Annexes.
Participate in high-level meetings with General Officers and other Senior Staff members and translate strategic vision into recommended actionable tasks.
Assist in defining A3, ACC and CAF positions and develop recommendations for issues affecting Combat Air Force operational training and readiness.
Assist in the analysis of current policies, programs and requirements as they apply to ACC and worldwide CAF operations and help develop solutions that can make these forces more effective in their ability to support warfighting COCOMs.
Interact and work in conjunction with the HQ ACC Senior Staff, their processes, and responsibilities.
Secret clearance required
Bachelor's degree
15 years of USAF fighter or bomber rated aviation experience, some of which was obtained within the last ten years
1 year of HQ staff experience at the NAF level or higher

Our people-first culture drives mission success.

ANALYGENCE provides leading-edge technology and result-focused solutions that address the infinite variables that affect our clients’ goals in the cyberspace, intelligence, and mission support domains.

Born out of diverse backgrounds and forged through government, military and industry experience, our team members are the backbone of our solutions. Our various perspectives advance capabilities and drive successful operations. Through our purpose-driven team culture, the productivity and effectiveness of critical missions are amplified.

Our vision is to continue to build an environment that encourages our people to evolve by applying a foundation of core values to everything we do. We focus on adding value to people so that they can bring value to others, and this culture drives our relentless pursuit of exceptional mission critical results.

DESCRIPTION

The Digital Health Technical Advisor will join JSI’s Center for Digital Health team, supporting JSI’s portfolio of digital health work across the organization. CDH help projects ensure success by promoting best practices in Digital Health through technical assistance, supporting new business development, and providing learning opportunities and guidance to build capacity. In particular, this person will serve as the technical lead to advance digital health objectives under MOMENTUM Integrated Health Resilience (MIHR). MIHR focuses on strengthening quality maternal, newborn, and child health, voluntary family planning and reproductive health service delivery in fragile settings, advancing global knowledge on strengthening MNCH/FP/RH service delivery and building resilience in fragile settings.

The Technical Advisor will lead in the development and implementation of digital health objectives across the MIHR portfolio. This involves supporting the continued evolution of the MIHR-IAM data collection system that supports the entire portfolio of work; supporting data collection, analytics and data visualization tools that permit the project teams to chart progress and identify challenges; and the implementation of other digital health interventions with country teams.

The Technical Advisor will report to the Deputy Director of the Center for Digital Health, with collaborative supervision by the MIHR Technical Director and MIHR Monitoring, Evaluation, Research and Learning (MERL) Director. S/He will work closely with other members of the MERL Team, and in collaboration with the Technical and Country Support Teams, to ensure the integration of digital health activities across core and country programs. This position will also coordinate with the MOMENTUM Knowledge Accelerator (MKA) project, and other MOMENTUM projects as appropriate. The Technical Advisor is a fulltime position. If the successful applicant is a resident in the United States, the following locations are acceptable based on registration: AZ, AR, CA, CO, FL, GA, IL, LA, ME, MA, MD, MI, MN, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, PA, RI, TN, TX, USVI, VT, VA, WA, WI, and Washington DC. These states are in addition to any country where JSI has registration. Note if overseas, this position will be paid in local currency.

RESPONSIBILITIES

MIHR, 75%

In collaboration with the technical and MERL teams, lead the MIHR project in the use of digital tools to improve health outcomes.
Oversee the MIHR digital health team
Supervise the MIHR MERL Data Management and Analytics Specialist to ensure functioning of the MIHR-IAM project data system, including management/oversight of data system contracts and consultants .
Collaborate/coordinate with, and be responsive to, MIHR internal customers (technical team, MERL and Leadership) to provide support for digital tool development, digital data collection, and database management
Ensure the presentation of project data supports project planning, decision making, policies, and course correction (including leveraging other resources within JSI’s Center for Health Information Monitoring and Evaluation as needed)
Work across the MIHR teams to support digital health efforts including (but not limited to): Digital Integrated Management of Childhood Illnesses (Digital IMCI);
Electronic Community Health Information System (eCHIS);
Digital Supportive Supervision;
Digital Maternal and Perinatal Death Audits;
Digital Micro-Planning & GIS Population Estimation;
Manage requests for support on application/data collection tool development on CommCare, and manage the development of those tools by Digital Health/MEL Program Officers
Represent MIHR on digital health across the suite of MOMENTUM awards

Center for Digital Health, 25%

Assisting projects in designing digital health interventions and digital strategy at all stages of the project lifecycle; based on project scope, assistance may range from high-level technical needs assessment and business analysis, down to field-level user experience design and workflow mapping
Identifying technology partners and solutions of interest for partnering both globally and in particular country or regional contexts
Providing input during proposal development for appropriate technology components of a public health technical approach
Participate in the development of internal resources to build organizational capacity in the use of digital health
Provide internal and external representation of JSI, including participation in JSI’s working groups, and external multi-agency working groups.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum of 7 years of leading digital health interventions in the international health sector with a preference for experience in digital M&E systems and use of data for adaptive management and program improvement.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize work effectively, particularly with remote teams.
Strong project management skills.
Experience with application development in CommCare strongly preferred.
Experience with working with DHIS2 strongly preferred.
Experience with standard documentation practices, including in-line documentation, technical and functional specifications, user manuals, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate and communicate technical concepts to non-technical colleagues and stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively and harmoniously in cross-cultural settings with other project staff, host country counterparts, USAID, consultants, other donors and international organizations.
Strong facilitation and/or training skills, with experience in participatory approaches, such as co-creation.
Demonstrated ability to supervise staff, including mentoring and capacity building.
General knowledge of global goods being used in the digital health space.
Experience working in low-and-middle-income countries within health or development is a plus.
Ability and willingness to travel domestically and internationally (up to 15%).
Ability to work flexible hours across multiple time zones.
Fluency in written and spoken English required; fluency and/or familiarity in French greatly valued.
Sense of humor.

Salary commensurate with experience.
