Description:

**local candidates strongly preferred due to onsite requirement

**candidate must be able to come to Richmond, VA occasionally

**candidate must have experience working in data management as an analyst

The Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT) Business Integrated Solutions Division (BISD) is seeking a Business with experience in data analytics to work as a key member of Business Analysis and Testing Support team. This analyst will support teams working in Agile (Sprint) as well as traditional Waterfall methodologies for Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).

Responsibilities include analyzing problems; documenting business processes and data lifecycle; developing data requirements, user stories and acceptance criteria; and testing. VDOT is a fast-paced organization with very high standards for work quality and efficiency. This position is expected to handle multiple projects, and remain flexible and productive, despite changing priorities and processes. Ongoing improvement and efficiency are a part of our culture, and each team member is expected to proactively contribute to process improvements.


Responsibilities:

Work with the Project team members and business stakeholders to understand business processes and pain points
Develop expertise in the customers’ datasets and data lifecycle
Profile source data; review source data and compare content and structure to dataset requirements; identify conflicts and determine recommendations for resolution
Conduct entity resolution to identify matching and merging and semantic conflicts
Elicit, record, and manage metadata
Diagram current processes and proposed modifications using process flows, context diagrams and data flow diagrams
Discover and document requirements and user stories with a focus on improving both business and technical processing
Decompose requirements into Epics and Features and create clear and concise user stories that are easy to understand and implement by technical staff
Utilize progressive elaboration; map stories to data models and architectures to be used by internal staff to facilitate master data management
Identify and group related user stories into themes, document dependencies and associated business processes
Assist Product Owner in maintaining the product backlog
Create conceptual prototypes and mock-ups
Collaborate with staff, vendors, consultants, and contractors as they are engaged on tasks to formulate, detail and test potential and implemented solutions
Perform Quality Analyst functions such as defining test objectives, test plans and test cases, and executing test cases
Coordinate and Facilitate User Acceptance Testing with Business and ensure Project Managers/Scrum Masters are informed of the progress


Qualifications


Required:

The candidate must have a minimum of 10 years of experience delivering business and data analysis artifacts.
5+ years of experience as an Agile Business Analyst; strong understanding of Scrum concepts and methodology
Experience organizing and maintaining Product and Sprint backlogs
Experience translating client and product strategy requirements into dataset requirements and user stories
Proficient with defining acceptance criteria and managing acceptance process
Experience with enterprise data management
Expertise with Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, Visio, PowerPoint, Project Server)
Experience with reporting systems – operational data stores, data warehouses, data lakes, data marts
The candidate must have exceptional written and oral communications skills and have the proven ability to work well with a diverse set of peers and customers

Preferred:

CBAP and/or CSPO Certification
CDMP and/or CDP Certification
Experience using Team Foundation Server and work item tracking
Experience with automated testing tools such as TestComplete
Requirements:

elivering business and systems analysis artifacts such as Business Requirements Documentation (BRD), Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM)-Required 10 Years
Experience with enterprise data management, data analysis, and data lifecycle-Required 5 Years
Agile Business Analyst; strong understanding of Scrum concepts and methodology-Required 5 Years
Experience translating business and product strategy requirements into application requirements and user stories-Required
Proficient with defining acceptance criteria and managing acceptance process with development-Required
Experience creating wireframes and prototypes (using applications such as Balsamiq)-Required
Experience with large, multi-module systems-Required
Expertise with Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, Visio, PowerPoint, Project Server)-Required
Experience with Application Lifecycle management (ALM)-Required
Exceptional written and oral communications skills and have the proven ability to work well with a diverse set of peers and customers-Required
Experience using Team Foundation Server for agile software development and work item tracking-Desired
Experience with automated testing tools such as TestComplete-Desired
Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) or Certified Data Professional (CDP)-Highly desired
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) Certification-Desired

Job Title: Operations Research Analyst, Army Resiliency Directorate Training Support, Arlington, Virginia
Job Description:
The Army Resiliency Directorate Training Support (ARD-TS) program delivers resilience and performance enhancement training and education to Soldiers, Family Members, and Civilians. This position will be responsible for creating and analyzing pre and post event surveys, create and deliver out briefs of survey data, summarize and thematically chunk open-ended comment data.

Assists in the identification of key business issues and the design of analytic approaches. Conducts research on identified key business issues. Evaluates and distills analyses conducted by internal and external customers.

Assists in developing and utilizing data gathering tools, such as surveys/questionnaires and/or interview questions to ensure that appropriate quantitative and qualitative data is gathered for the analyses. Extracts data for analysis and interpretation.

Conducts quantitative and qualitative analyses on a broad array of issues across disciplines, projects and functional areas. Structures and executes analysis independently.

Prepares preliminary interpretations of analyses for project teams, clients, and/or program leadership. Recommends suggested action steps based on the analytic results.

Performs database management tasks to include: preparing reports, synthesizing and analyzing results, and highlighting implications of findings. Follows through any further actions based on the results using sound business judgment.

Assists in the development of project proposals, recommendations, implementation plans, communication packages, performance measurement tools, and training materials related to the assigned projects.

Creates and analyzes pre and post event surveys, creates and delivers outbriefs of survey data, summarizes and thematically chunks open-ended comment data.

Utilizes statistics and statistical analysis packages software such as SPSS, R, SAS, and DOD approved survey administration software (such as Qualtrics).

Collects quarterly review data, client feedback questionnaires, training evaluations, program awareness and program effectiveness feedback, and provides this information as directed.

Participates in monthly conference calls and annual training events and provides input into monthly, annual, and quarterly reports.

Other duties as assigned.

Other Job Requirements

Responsibilities

Bachelor’s degree in operations research; or a degree with at least 24 semester hours in a combination of operations research, mathematics, probability, statistics, mathematical logic, science, or subject-matter courses requiring substantial competence in college-level mathematics or statistics.

2+ years of experience in operations research.

Proficiency in statistics and statistical analysis packages software such as SPSS, R, SAS, and DOD Approved survey administration software (such as Qualtrics).

Experience with all Microsoft Office Products, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, and SharePoint.

Possess strong expertise in MS Excel and relational database such as MS Access and other database management (MS SQL) and reporting tools.

Possess strong organizational and communications skills, both verbal and written.

Works under time pressure and rapidly for long periods to meet deadlines.

Must speak, read, understand, and write English fluently.

StraitSys Inc
Regular
PRIMARY FUNCTION

StraitSys is seeking a Principal Business Analyst to support the FBI in Quantico, Virginia. In this role, you will provide technical, managerial, and administrative advice to the Project Manager (PM) concerning the functional area under study. Using a working knowledge of process development, business process reengineering, and performance improvement methodologies you will advise and make recommendations on organizational-wide system improvements.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Work independently and/or directly for the PM providing technical, managerial, and administrative expertise.
Collaborate with stakeholders across processes, facilities, locations, units, and levels (staff to executive) to gain an understanding of business objectives, facilitate defining measurement solutions and implement business processes and techniques that drive performance.
Contribute to analysis to create a story with themes that clearly show issues and required actions that will improve performance.
Recognize data variances and trends, research causal factors and recommend possible solutions.
Support initiatives that track process adherence and performance to improvement plans, including, but is not limited to, the implementation of key performance indicators (KPIs), service level agreements (SLAs) and dashboards to monitor process and drive accountability.
Research best business practices within and outside the organization to establish benchmark data.
Analyzes and measures the effectiveness of existing business processes.
Determines how new information technologies can support reengineering business processes.
Prepare and analyze management and site-specific reports to meet the needs of program stakeholders, increase risk awareness, and support decision making.
Complete change management assessments and change management strategies.
Create actionable deliverables, such as a communication plan, roadmap, coaching plan, training plan, or resistance management plan.
Apply strong analytical and technical skills to document findings in accordance with approved quality procedures and standards.
Defining and measuring success metrics and monitor change progress.
Analyze and document functional requirements, business process drawings/flow charts, functional specifications, requirements roadmap.
Participate in the validation and traceability of functional requirements to functional specifications, system technical specification.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: No
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES

Demonstrated experience as a Principal Business Analyst overseeing/managing the delivery of modern and cutting-edge IT across multiple lines of business within the information management/records management domain.
Advanced knowledge in process development, business process reengineering, and performance improvement methodologies
Ability to apply process improvement and reengineering methodologies and principles to conduct process modernization projects.
Proficient experience in process mapping, data analysis and project management.
Ability to analyze business and technical processes to formulate and develop new and modified business information processing systems.
Ability to represent business stakeholders to define functional requirements and business cases for the process improvements and technology developments.
Ability to organize data from multiple sources and turn large data sets into meaningful, actionable information.
Ability to use data visualization to tell a clear and compelling insight.
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents and implementation plans.
Proven skill in group facilitation, interviewing, training, and additional forms of knowledge transfer.
Proficient skills in Microsoft Office and Atlassian with advanced skills in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.
Adept at working with customers to extract business requirements and preparing documentation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders, and management on both the business and IT sides.
Strong leadership skills and coaching/mentoring skills
Strong business acumen and detail-oriented
Strong critical thinking skills and a quick learner
Demonstrated experience and expertise in business models and technology integration.
QUALIFICATIONS

Must be a US Citizen.
Active Top Secret Clearance; may be required to obtain SCI access
BA/BS degree required. This position requires a minimum of twenty-five (25) years of specialized experience in the functional area being studied and at least a bachelor's degree. A master's or doctorate degree is preferred. With thirty (30) years of specialized experience, a degree is not required.
Accredited in Lean, Six Sigma or other process improvement technologies.
Ability to successfully pass a pre-employment drug test.

Sr. Business Analyst

Position Description
The ideal candidate for this position is a problem solver. This job supports one or more analytical aspects of the application product life cycle, within a sub-product scope (one or more application components). Uses regular judgement and discretion to collaborate with customers.

This position can be worked Nationwide.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Gather project specifications, Create business cases and cost sheet analysis, Translate high-level business needs into detailed requirements for new capabilities and change request/enhancements on existing capabilities,
Analyze data to determine business problems, trends, or opportunities for process improvements,
Create/execute test cases, Provide root cause analysis and corrective action plans,
Verify delivery of customer needs, and Ensure quality delivery.
Builds organizational and platform knowledge in one or more disciplines to advance professional track career.
Uses functional and organizational knowledge to mentor junior resources. Requires thorough understanding of end systems impact of changes across multiple systems.
Work with customers, Software Engineers, Architects, and other team members to capture capability needs and drive quality business solutions.
Create and maintain deliverables such as business vision, requirements and personalization to different clients, and user interface design.
Build business cases and results measurement programs and prepare briefings for senior leadership
Participate in the full software development life cycle by actively participating on Agile scrum teams in various roles, including, but not limited to, Scrum Master, Business Technical Analyst, User Interface designer, Capability Manager, or Tester, based upon experience and need.
Support various aspects of requirements testing (e.g. testing plan, scenarios, documentation, defect management) to ensure minimal production defects are realized and completing analysis of the results tying back to customer impacts.
Ensure compliance for required standards and all necessary approvals have been obtained throughout the project lifecycle.
Effectively communicate with team members, customers, partners and management, including assisting with or conducting requirement walkthroughs and sprint reviews, reporting project status, enabling vendor solutions and providing accurate and concise documentation.
Assist execution of user acceptance testing, documenting process, requirements, and enabling execution
Ability to analyze business processes, identify needs for advanced analytics solutions, and convey those insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong understanding of process design and execution, ability to identify ways to integrate advanced analytics solutions into existing business processes
Working knowledge of analytics governance processes, stakeholder management, project management / agile delivery
Other duties as assigned.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

7 years work experience as a business analyst on a software-focused team
Knowledge of SDLC, Agile
Functional analysis and strong writing skills.
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work effectively within a team environment under tight timelines
Ability to multi-task and support multiple projects at once
Experience working with JIRA and Confluence

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Integrated Problem Solving

Develop and champion a bold vision that drives meaningful outcomes by embracing the art of the possible

Build frameworks for complex decision making that enable effective debate and accelerate getting to the right answer

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 year of product management experience or at least 3 year of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Job Family:

Data Science Consulting


Travel Required:

None


Clearance Required:

Active Secret

What You Will Do:

Our consultants focusing on data science and analytics help clients maximize the value of their data. These high performing individuals works with clients to implement the full spectrum of data analytics and data science services, from data querying and wrangling to data engineering, to data visualization, dashboarding, and business intelligence (BI), to predictive analytics, machine learning (ML), and artificial intelligence (AI). Our services enable our clients to define their information strategy, enable mission critical insights and data-driven decision making, reduce cost and complexity, increase trust, and improve operational effectiveness.

Provide the full spectrum of data science services to support the mission of National Security clients.
Engage clients to define requirements, elicit feedback, and communicate results.
Collaborate with other data science and analytics professionals across our Defense & Security segment and provide data science / data analytics / business intelligence services on cross-functional teams delivering other consulting services as well.
Focus on client services, while also supporting business development, internal firm initiatives, and ongoing professional development in data science, analytics, and consulting.
Analyze large and complex datasets (structured and unstructured), with a strong aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis.
Query and join data using SQL.
Wrangle, clean, and analyze data using Python or R.
Develop advanced dashboards using Tableau, demonstrating data visualization and business intelligence (BI) best practices.
Uphold strong data management.
Write technical process documentation.
Communicate/present ideas, methods, and results to clients, and explain technical topics to non-technical audiences.
Identify and address client needs, build strong client relationships, and driving initiatives forward.
Support business development including RFP, RFQ, and RFI responses and white papers.
Operate successfully on remote projects as well as hybrid on-site projects in the DC metro area.


What You Will Need:

An ACTIVE and CURRENT SECRET federal security clearance
Bachelor's Degree and 1+ years of relevant professional experience OR a M.S./M.A. degree in a relevant quantitative and computational discipline.
Proficiency in querying and joining data using SQL.
Proficiency in wrangling, cleaning, and analyzing data using Python or R.
Proficiency in developing advanced dashboards using Tableau.
Ability to support remote projects and hybrid on-site projects in the DC metro area.


What Would Be Nice To Have:

Active Top Secret clearance.
M.S. or M.A. in a relevant quantitative and computational discipline.
2+ years of relevant professional experience.
Tableau Desktop Certification.
Experience utilizing Tableau jointly with Python or R.
Experience scraping data using Python.
Experience in machine learning model development using Python or R.
Experience supporting Federal National Security organizations.

Sr. Business Analyst

Summary: As a Senior Business Analyst at Capital One, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. You will team with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. Analysis: Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and solve for them using analysis to make strategic or tactical recommendations

Product: Perform modeling/analytics to assist new product and pricing strategies for various lending products

Execution: Involve problem frame-works, develop hypotheses, test and analysis, solution development, scope operational feasibility, lead implementation efforts and develop a monitoring plan

Strong communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills

Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. Previous consulting experience is a plus

Bachelor’s Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering)

At least 1 year of experience in analysis

Master’s Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering

1+ years of experience in Statistical model building

1+ years of experience in market research

Job Title: Business Analysis Manager


Job Summary:

The Business Analysis Manager is responsible for leading a team of IT business analysts to support the planning, development, and implementation of technology solutions within the government sector. This position plays a critical role in understanding business needs, assessing existing systems, and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that IT projects align with government objectives and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities:

Team Leadership:
Manage and lead a team of IT business analysts, providing guidance, mentorship, and performance management.
Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages professional development and knowledge sharing.
Business Analysis:
Identify, document, and analyze business processes, requirements, and objectives.
Develop and maintain a clear understanding of government policies, regulations, and procedures related to technology projects.
Collaborate with business units to define project scope and objectives.
Requirements Elicitation:
Engage with stakeholders to gather, validate, and prioritize requirements for IT projects.
Create detailed requirements documentation, including functional and technical specifications user stories and functional workflows
Solution Design and Planning:
Translate business requirements into technology solutions and systems.
Work with architects and technical teams to design efficient and cost-effective solutions.
Develop project plans, timelines, and resource allocation to ensure successful project implementation.
Quality Assurance:
Conduct thorough testing and validation of IT solutions to ensure they meet established requirements and government standards.
Implement quality control measures to identify and rectify defects in the systems.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Facilitate communication and collaboration between IT teams, government departments, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment with government goals and objectives.
Compliance and Security:
Ensure that all IT solutions meet government security and compliance requirements.
Stay current with evolving regulations and implement necessary changes to maintain compliance.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain comprehensive records of project documentation, status reports, and project outcomes.
Prepare and present reports to senior management and government officials as required.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
At least 5 years of experience in IT business analysis, with 2 years in a managerial role.
Strong understanding of government operations, policies, and regulations.
Proven experience in leading and managing IT project teams.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in business analysis tools and methodologies.
Knowledge of project management principles and methodologies (e.g., PMI, Agile, Scrum).
Familiarity with government-specific software and systems is a plus.
Professional certifications, such as CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional), PMP (Project Management Professional), or similar, are advantageous.

Ready to take ACTION in your career? ACT1 Federal is seeking a Business Process Analyst in Arlington, VA. #Hiring

ACT1 Federal is all about taking bold, innovative actions to deliver for our customers and our workforce. Every day, members of the ACT1 Federal team drive creative solutions on the most challenging problems facing customers across the Aviation, Space / Intelligence, and International Cooperation portfolios

Leading the execution of complex tasks and performing more complex analytical and evaluative work requiring a comprehensive knowledge of:

(4) related basic economic, accounting, and legal principles.
Assisting programs/project personnel with financial tracking, budget formulation, execution, and overall financial support.
Providing support with a variety of management activities, corporate initiatives, special projects, and data calls which could have a significant impact on the organization and its business operations
Tracking and managing financial and other business transactions that cite DARPA funding.
Providing standard operating procedure, work instruction reviews, transaction and reconciliation support in managing and executing funding, which includes building MIPRs and PRs and using various reports to track commitments, obligations, and expenditures and perform reconciliation of funds.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED:

**Secret Clearance is required**

A Bachelor's in Business, Management, Finance, or Accounting

Financial analysis of business programs, development of cost estimates, program status reports
Demonstrated knowledge of DoD Federal Management Regulations (FMR), Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), PPBE, and DoD procurement experience

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products, primarily Excel, PowerPoint, and Project.

This incumbent assists the LCD Operations Lead and team in the management, coordination, planning, contracting, budgeting, scheduling, and tracking of significant facility/site activation events and deliverables for the Site and Ship Activation Team. He/she provides on-site program continuity, technical and analytical assistance in the preparation of team briefings, correspondence, data analysis and distribution. As an operations analyst, they support a matrixed team of government, military, and contractor personnel supporting Site Activation and Introduction to Service activity.

Specifically, the incumbent supports the following team activities:

Current Operations: The team is responsible for scheduling and de-conflicting events, real-time assignment of traveling team composition, ensuring sufficient funding, monitoring event execution, and ensuring after-action activity completion. Incumbent uses established meetings, processes, and tools to accomplish this task.

Scheduling: The team leads the development, build and management of the LCD Integrated Master Schedule to track site activation events as a part of the Intro to Service planning activities. As such, must be capable of developing schedules from elements in facilities planning documentation, Site Activation reports, and F-35 JPO documents (Master Schedule, etc). The team supports the Program Management of Site, Ship, and Depot Activation milestones/ activities within the F-35 Enterprise Integrated Master Schedule as it relates to all phases of site activation from preparation for first aircraft arrival, through Initial Operational Capability (IOC) declaration, to last aircraft arrival at a given site/ship. Further, responsible for managing of scheduled events via LCD tools and procedures.

Budget: The team is responsible to develop, build, manage, and reconcile the team travel budget from cradle to grave. Responsible for obligation, expenditures and routine reconciliation of team funds.

Document Management: The team leads the effort to manage all reports delivered by the LCD Team Leads, industry, the services, and customers from Site Activation (SA) events. Required to actively manage, catalogue and build Document Manager (DM) files to support future data management and data gathering activities.

Contract Management: The team is responsible for the internal execution of LCD contracting activity to include requirement development, scheduling, tracking of expenditures, tracking of contract execution, performance evaluation, and consolidation of future requirements. She/he leads the effort in the Technical Evaluation of Proposals and ensures compliance with mandated suspense’s.

Planning: The team leads the effort to develop and maintain all sustainment plans and site execution events within the cognizance of LCD via the Integrated Sustainment Plans (ISP), Site Specific Activation Plans (SSAP), Site Specific Master Plan (SSAMP), LCD input into the Weapon System Planning Document (WSPD), trip reports, and other Program supporting plans and deliverables. He/she coordinates reviews and provides insight into the development of the overarching structural documentation to include strategy and budget.

Software Tools: The team acts as the lead, Technical Point of Contract (TPOC) and Project Manager (PM) for all LCD software tools (LSET, AIT, and IOP tracker). Further, the team is responsible for development of future software tools such as a F-35 Beddown Management Tool.

Site Activation General Support: The team supports other Logistics Capability Delivery activities as directed to include: Sustainment Readiness Reviews; Integrated Sustainment Plan generation; Site Activation events; and onsite/offsite conferences and working groups, various briefings.

Software Skills: Must be able to compose/update documents and design/build management products using all Microsoft (MS) Office products and other applications as required. These include, but are not limited to, MS Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, and Project.

Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS:

Required:

Ability to obtain a secret clearance.

Able to support CONUS/OCONUS Travel 8-10 times/year

Desired:

Knowledge of military aviation maintenance, supply, operations, and/or life cycle logistics infrastructure and processes.

Bachelors Degree or Higher with course work in either business, logistics, management, or finance.

Greater than 10 years experience in:

Aircraft Maintenance

or

1. Military Logistics

or

2. Program Management

or

3. Military aviation

Functional knowledge of project management methodologies.

Familiar with Microsoft Office Program Suite (Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Outlook, Project)

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:

Occasional CONUS travel (6-8 trips per year) to various government labs and contractor facilities.

Occasional OCONUS travel (1-2 trips per year) to various government and contractor facilities

Job Title: Project Manager

Yakshna Solutions, Inc., (YSI) is a CMMI Level 3 assessed, ISO 9001, 20000:1, 27001 certified, woman-owned small business enterprises, headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, USA. YSI provides professional IT solutions and services to business corporations and government organizations. We offer a competitive benefits package that includes the following: 401(k), health, dental, and vision insurance, Life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance, paid time off, training, and professional development assistance.

YSIis seeking a highly qualified Project Manager. The selected candidate will be able to communicate effectively (written/verbal), possess strong interpersonal skills, be self-motivated, and be innovative in a fast-paced environment.

· The Project Manager shall be the main point of contact for interaction and coordination with the Government COR.

· The Project Manager is required to manage the daily operations of the contractor team. The Project Manager has direct accountability for the technical correctness, timeliness and quality of all services performed and items delivered.

· The Project Manager role requires knowledge and experience with IT project management, quality assurance, requirements management, process analysis, and business analysis.

· 10 years’ experience, of which at least eight (8) years must be specialized. Specialized experience includes project development from inception to deployment, expertise in management and control of funds and resources using complex reporting mechanisms, demonstrated capability in management multi-task contracts and/or subcontracts of various types and complexity. General experience includes increasing responsibilities in information systems design and/or management.

This opportunity resides with Live, Virtual, Constructive Solutions, a business group within HII's Mission Technologies division. As a trusted partner to our military customers, we design, develop and operate systems that bring together service members from across the globe to help you train like you fight, because we understand that preparation requires full coordination-not readiness in piece parts.

Meet HII's Mission Technologies Division
Our team of more than 7,000 professionals worldwide delivers all-domain expertise and advanced technologies in service of mission partners across the globe. Mission Technologies is leading the next evolution of national defense - the data evolution - by accelerating a breadth of national security solutions for government and commercial customers. Find the role that's right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you.

Job Description

Huntington Ingalls is seeking skilled talent to join a team that conducts research and development to identify future challenges and opportunities, develops warfighting concepts, and comprehensively explores options to inform the United States Marine Corps' (USMC) combat development process and meet the challenges of future operating environments.
This Research Analyst position will enhance the ability of the MCWL to plan, support, integrate, execute, and report on force design experiments.
The primary purpose of the position is to:

Analyze actual and predictable interacting operational activities of a business to obtain a quantitative, rational basis for decision-making by applying logic and scientific or economic disciplines and techniques
Apply basic principles, theories, and concepts and limited industry knowledge
Solve routine problems of limited scope and complexity and refer more complex issues to higher levels

Essential Job Responsibilities

Must Have:

Ability to communicate technical concepts to operational Subject Matter Experts (SME) and experiment planners
Experience leveraging scientific methods to inform qualitative and quantitative analyses
Experience with DoD organizations (particularly NAVY/USMC)
Experience in a Joint or Service Headquarters organization
Ability to coordinate with multiple, non-matrixed stakeholders to gather data
Ability to interface with other key stakeholders on issues related to allies and partners, international engagements, and strategic development
Ability to read, write, and communicate professionally and effectively across the civilian and military spectrum from the Action Officer to the General Officer and Flag Officer
Experience and current proficiency with one or more programming /scripting languages( R, Python and SQL preferred)
Ability to analyze large, complex data sets and develop mathematical models to support a variety of client problems
Ability to communicate in person, over virtual platforms, and in writing with teammates, operational SMEs, and senior leaders
Ability to work in a team environment
25% travel (domestic and foreign)
Must have the ability to obtain a U.S. passport
On-site support required (Must Interface with customers on a daily basis)
Must be a US Citizen with an active SECRET clearance and the ability to obtain a TOP SECRET/SENSITIVE COMPARTMENTALIZED INFORMATION clearance

Minimum Qualifications

5 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; 3 years relevant experience with Masters in related field; 0 years experience with PhD or Juris Doctorate in related field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 9 years relevant experience.

In some cases educational requirements may be adjusted or waived for more than 10 years applicable work experience.

Preferred Requirements


Experience with U.S. Marine Corps MAGTF capabilities, posture, and operations
Experience conducting strategic-level planning and wargaming for DOD
Expertise in Design of Experiments and the Operational Test and Evaluation (ODT&E) process

Job Title: Principal - Public Sector Pricing Strategist, BUSINESS DESK
Job Description:
BA/BS degree in Operations, Finance, or Economics.
10+ years of relevant experience in business analysis.
8+ years of experience leading and developing teams
Prior work experience in technology industry.
Current, active US Government Security Clearance of TS/SCI with Polygraph
Do you want to be part of world’s most customer centric company and its leading brand of cloud services? Do you love analyzing large scale data and driving simplification and strategic decisions? Are you great at cross functional coordination and building consensus around approaches? Do you have a knack for analyzing business deals, and for developing deal terms that represent a win-win for all stakeholders? Can you take complex scenarios and simplify them down to the essentials, crafting elegant terms that are easy to understand and apply? Are you good at defining and communicating streamlined deal workflows, and building consensus around approaches? If the answer is yes to all, this is a perfect role for you.
Worldwide Public Sector Business Desk under Amazon Web Services is currently looking for a Business Desk Manager to support the Public Sector sales, operations, capture/proposal, partner, legal, and finance teams. The ideal candidate has a background in deal financial construction, business operations, sales and a background that enables them to model terms that reflect the best interests of the business and the customer. The candidate will have the Financial depth and business experience to easily communicate the economic benefits of cloud computing to IT C-Level executives. The candidate will be comfortable writing, researching and presenting ideas to executives and large crowds. This candidate should demonstrate the ability to devise new programs, pricing strategies and think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses. As a leader within the Public Deals Desk team, you will identify entry barriers to adoption of AWS with these customers and develop repeatable strategies and models to overcome these barriers. The candidate should also have some technical depth to help them reason about the technologies and services involved in a coherent way. The ability to be influential, and work cross-organizationally is important, and the successful candidate will have a keen sense of ownership and drive results. The individual will have executive presence and the ability to present the complex in a clear and concise manner to senior management. Experience in Datacenter and Cloud Infrastructure services is a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Working directly with customers, sale teams, sales leaders, services/support teams, and AWS leadership teams – provide leadership, identify customer blockers/enablers, and close issues.
Bring the various stakeholders including but not limited to Sales, Contracts, Finance, Legal, Security and Compliance to close custom deals.
Assist with complex contract negotiations and manage the approval process, including liaising with involved internal groups such as Legal, Finance, Services, etc.
Design Tableau BI analytics for Business Desk and senior management for quarterly business reviews and reporting.
Able to train and work closely with sales teams to make sure everyone is aware of the process and constructs, and to quickly execute on deals that are in the pipeline.
Optimize existing processes and develop new scalable/repeatable process.
Able to negotiate public sector deals from a business desk perspective (legal, contract, business, etc.)
Understand the business and technical requirements of our customers and partners, and work closely with the internal teams to fashion appropriate deal terms.
Building new/improving existing data reporting and processes. Report on monthly, quarterly and annual pipeline metrics and business forecasts inclusive of Run Rate, Opportunity and Contractual elements.
Providing business or pricing analysis to prioritize and lead deal construct efforts.
Support Public Sector Partner teams with custom pricing.
Sourcing, analyzing, and reporting quantitative data; perform ad hoc analyses.
Analyzing trends, formulating projections, creating financial models, and evaluating alternatives.
Provide fact-based insights into variances and trends.
Ability to quickly build credibility and trust with internal customers.
Demonstrated work ethic based on a strong desire to exceed expectations.
Data analysis and financial modeling skills.
Strong leadership, negotiation, communication, and persuasion skills.
Advanced communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to travel up to 25%
The candidate should demonstrate the proven ability to:

Develop new ideas and creative solutions.
Work successfully in an ambiguous environment.
Meet tight deadlines and prioritize workload.
Work on cross-functional teams.
Focus on customers and work backwards.
Create detailed financial models and perform self-directed analysis.
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This position requires that the candidate selected be a US citizen and must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph.

Herndon, VA, USA


MBA in Finance or Operations.
Knowledge and experience in Cloud infrastructure.
Knowledge and work experience with Public Sector Partners.
Proficiency in one or more of the following: SQL, and Microsoft Access.
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst (BA)/ Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer
Job Description:
Western Door Federal is part of the Seneca Nation Group (SNG) portfolio of companies. SNG is the federal government contracting business wholly owned by the Seneca Nation. SNG meets mission-critical needs of federal civilian, defense, and intelligence community customers across a variety of domains. The SNG portfolio receives shared services support from its parent company Seneca Holdings and is comprised of multiple companies that participate in the Small Business Administration 8(a) program. To learn more visit www.senecanationgroup.com and follow us on LinkedIn.

The Seneca Nation Group companies offer competitive compensation and a strong benefits package including comprehensive medical and dental care, matching 401K, paid time off, flexible spending accounts, disability coverage, and other benefits that help provide financial protection for you and your family. We pride ourselves on our collaborative work environment and culture which embraces our mission of providing financial and non-financial benefits back to the members of the Seneca Nation.

Western Door Federal is seeking a Technical Business Analyst / Quality Assurance Engineer (BA/QA) to support a recently awarded contract with the United States Military Academy - West Point. The objective of this work is to provide support comprehensive cloud solution services, hosted in MS Azure, as part of a larger team.

The Technical Business Analyst / Quality Assurance Engineer (BA/QA) role reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support overall business strategies. Documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and prioritizing work items that drive system development and implementation. The BA/QA will be responsible for overseeing and managing end-to-end testing including creating and executing tests and leading User Acceptance Testing.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Gather and document functional and user experience requirements.
Develop UI wireframes and functional workflows, as needed.
Communicate insights and findings to internal teams and customers.
Make recommendations for business processes and efficiency improvements.
Develop epics, features, user stories and manage defects using Azure DevOps.
Collaborate with business stakeholders and software engineers to ensure accurate and effective implementation of functional requirements.
Defines and prepares system, business, and functional requirements and specifications.
Develop, execute, and document system test plans.
Develop and maintain user training documentation.
Communicate application upgrades to key stakeholders and assist in training front-end users on system changes or upgrades.
Collaborate with team to organize and prioritize work items.
Work with the team to develop suitable solutions for issues/errors based on the understanding of the system and client business processes.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree.
Minimum five years of professional BA/QA experience in software development.
Experience conducting QA testing and leading UAT handoff sessions with stakeholders.
Experience with wireframe and process flow development
Knowledge of SQL Server including experience with writing basic SQL queries
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with Azure DevOps work item management and CI/CD pipeline management.
Experience with Cloud Services. preferably Azure.
Strong attention to detail, analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on quality and accuracy.
Proficient in all phases of testing and types of testing – Functional, non-functional; smoke, sanity, integration, usability, User Acceptance, end-to-end, regression and performance.
Experience with BA/QA tools and software, including but not limited to, Azure DevOps, SQL Server Management Studio, Visio, Excel, Word, Visual Studio, PowerShell, etc.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Must be inquisitive and possess a strong desire to learn.

Desired Qualifications:

Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) Certification.
Experience in test automation/test automation tools.
Experience with automated UI testing and browser tools.

Journeymen Operations Research Analyst – Open Source Practitioner

Location: Charlottesville, VA




Join our team at Core One! Our mission is to be at the forefront of devising analytical, operational, and technical solutions to our Nation's most complex national security challenges. In order to achieve our mission, Core One values people first! We are committed to recruiting, nurturing, and retaining top talent! We offer a competitive total compensation package that sets us apart from our competition. Core One is a team-oriented, dynamic, and growing company that values exceptional performance!




Core One is searching for a seasoned Journeymen Operations Research Analyst to join a prestigious defense and security organization dedicated to delivering cutting-edge solutions in support of our military and government clients. We are currently looking for a skilled Analyst to become an integral part of our Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) team, where you will contribute significantly to our mission in serving our valued military clientele. As a Journeyman Operations Research Analyst - Open Source Practitioner with Core One, you will play a pivotal role in gathering, analyzing, and leveraging open source intelligence (OSINT) to support critical objectives within the Army's mission. Your expertise in conducting OSINT operations, collaborating with various intelligence disciplines, and providing actionable insights will contribute to our success.




Key Responsibilities: In this role you will:

Demonstrate proficiency in the collection and exploitation of PAI by effectively utilizing OSINT tools.
Employ sophisticated methodologies to exploit social media platforms and public-accessible databases, contributing to intelligence objectives.
Create in-depth OSINT reports and network analysis products that serve as valuable resources for informed decision-making.
Skillfully gather, synthesize, and analyze open source intelligence information, aligning efforts with force protection, counterterrorism, counternarcotic, and other mission-critical objectives.
Foster coordination and collaboration with subject matter experts across various intelligence disciplines to develop finished intelligence products, including comprehensive threat assessments.
Assess the latest developments in OSINT methodologies and tools, offering formal recommendations to enhance our capabilities.
Provide timely and critical intelligence support by promptly addressing Requests for Information (RFIs).
Communicate key insights derived from OSINT to senior personnel and officers as needed, ensuring clear and effective communication.
Provide valuable insights and input to shape the development of OSINT training requirements, ensuring our team maintains a leading edge in expertise.
Assume responsibility for operational planning, technical documentation, and other tasks as directed by the customer, actively contributing to mission success.
Identify and address issues with OSINT tools to maintain and optimize operational efficiency, ensuring seamless intelligence operations.

Required Education, Experience, & Qualifications:

Active TS/SCI security clearance.
Successful completion of Government OSINT Training courses (e.g., OS301/OS302, CASO), or equivalent defense or IC courses (DIA OS1, FBI OS101).
A minimum of 3 years of demonstrated intelligence experience with a BA/BS degree, or 5 years with an AS degree, or 7 years with a high school diploma.
Proficiency in using Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS) OSINT tools, including the Berber Hunter Tool Kit applications (e.g., SILO, SCRAAWL, Data Miner, and Babel).
Demonstrated experience in a field related to OSINT research, collection management, analysis, or the exploitation of PAI or social media.
Previous military or government analytical training (e.g., all source, SIGINT, HUMINT, or GEOINT).

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills:

Proven experience in providing intelligence analytical support for the Department of Defense (DoD).
Foreign language proficiency at the 2+/2+ DLPT level or higher.
Knowledge of scripting languages and technologies, including Python, Java, R Script, and JEMA.
Demonstrated experience in researching tradecraft relevancy.
Familiarity with distributed learning methodologies and technologies.
Proficiency with MS Office and SharePoint.

Position Title: Air Vehicle Program Analyst (PA-Mid)


Provides program analyst support to the F-35 Joint Program Office Air Vehicle Program Management Office (AV PMO) in providing lifecycle cost, schedule, and performance of aircraft, avionics, sensors, weapons integration, and modifications in the F-35 Lightning II Enterprise. Supports AV PMO in delivering 5th Generation tactical aircraft to U.S. Services, Partners, and Foreign Military Sales (FMS) customers.





Location: Arlington, VA


Security Clearance Level: Secret


Duties and Responsibilities

The Air Vehicle (AV) Program Management Office (PMO) is responsible for the following Mission System duties:

F-35 Block 4 Modernization - assist AV PMO in providing airborne systems capable of operating effectively in highly contested battle spaces now and in the foreseeable future.
Specialized Engineering - assist AV PMO in ensuring that the AV meets the approved design requirements.
Development Foundation Contract (DFC) - assist AV PMO in providing manpower and material support to the Integrated Test Force (ITFs) (FTW, NAS Patuxent River, and Edwards AFB) as well as the FTW and Supplier labs to enable F-35 Development, Sustainment, and Production efforts.
Developmental Test Viability (DTV) - assist AV PMO in providing life limiting modification and Flight Test Instrumentation (FTI) sustainment support for the Developmental Test fleet aircraft to enable Block 3 and Block 4 testing.
Weapons - assist AV PMO in providing lifecycle management of unique aircraft hardware that allow for carriage and employment of weapons; assist in coordinating across the F-35 enterprise and external weapons programs to ensure necessary designs are implemented across the Air System to permit the effective employment of weapons.


Knowledge and Qualifications

Bachelors Degree in Science, Engineering, Business Management or related discipline and 6 years of experience in program management, technical or business analysis discipline, in weapon systems acquisition and life cycle management; and a minimum of 4 years out of 6 of recent work experience related to analysis and planning. At least 2 years in support of a Major Defense Acquisition Program (MDAP). May substitute an Associates Degree with 10 years of experience.
Knowledge of the principles, policies, and practices of system acquisition to plan, organize, and coordinate critical aspects of the development, production, deployment, and sustainment of systems, subsystems, and equipment.
Knowledge of the FAR for the development of contracts and contract modifications required for the acquisition of logistics supportability products.
Demonstrated experience in the program/project status, schedules, and DoD reporting.
Demonstrated knowledge of Service and OSD policy and documentation related to PPBS, life- cycle management of military acquisition programs(as specified in the DoD 5000 series), to include DoD Instruction (DoDI) 5000.2, DoD Directive(DODD) 5530.03, and the International Cooperation in Acquisition, Technology and Logistics (IC in AT&L) Handbook.

Description:

The Financial Analyst is a key role within our Program Management Organization (PMO) that oversees a portfolio of IT investments for the federal government. We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Financial Analyst to support the financial management and budgetary operations for our federal government client in the Washington, DC metro area. This position will involve a wide range of financial analysis tasks, including budget formulation, financial forecasting, and performance metrics tracking. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of federal government financial systems and possess the analytical capability to enhance financial decision-making.

Requirements:


Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with expertise MS Excel skills to efficiently manipulate large data sets using formulas, pivot tables, charts, and graphs to produce meaningful analyses and reports.
Experience in developing, maintaining, and analyzing financial data in spreadsheets with a keen attention to detail.
Competence in integrating Excel with other Microsoft Office tools, such as importing/exporting data between Excel and Word or PowerPoint for reporting and presentation purposes.
Familiarity with federal government financial reporting and tracking procedures and guidelines.
In-depth knowledge of Capital Investment and Operations funding categories and the processes used to manage them.
Demonstrated experience in preparing financial reports and presentations for senior management and stakeholders.
Ability to formulate strategic plans that align with long-term program objectives.
Analytical mindset capable of solving complex financial problems and making data-driven decisions.
Strong collaboration skills to effectively work with cross-functional teams in communicating financial status.
A meticulous approach to data accuracy and financial analysis.
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment.
Responsibilities:


Data Analysis: Gather and interpret financial data to make informed recommendations to client on short-term and long-term financial planning and strategies.
Financial Tracking: Track obligations and expenditures to ensure compliance with budgetary guidelines and financial policies. Create annual spend plans.
Budgeting: Assist in the planning, creation, and coordination of budgets in accordance with federal guidelines, regulations, and industry best practices.
Financial Forecasting: Analyze financial trends and project future revenues and expenses to use for strategic financial planning.
Performance Evaluation: Monitor the financial performance of the company and compare it to its strategic objectives and competitors.
Reporting: Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for that detail financial status and health of program. Report submissions include financial data and metrics to internal and external stakeholders and external government agencies. Perform ad-hoc financial analysis as requested by the management team or client.
Advisory: Provide guidance to management on financial performance, including cost underruns, overruns...etc.
Develop Financial Models: Create advanced models to predict financial performance under various scenarios and to support long-term financial planning initiatives.
Collaboration: Work closely with team and project managers to analyze cost structures and financial risks.
Qualifications:


Must have previous government experience with strong writing, communication, and organizational skills.
Must have the ability to interact effectively with users and stakeholders throughout the organization.
Must be able to support a PMO and possess a good understanding of federal government contracting principles and practices. Experience with IT infrastructure systems, and IT infrastructure life cycle management, budgeting and financial analysis.
Must have proven business analysis skills, not associated with software development.
Ability to coordinate and prioritize concurrent activities within deadline-driven climate.
Ability to ask the right questions to identify the core business processes and the business rules that control or guide them. Strong customer focus and management of relationship with user community.
Experience:


Highly proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint), MS Teams, and MS SharePoint. Experience using tools for developing workflow analysis.
Education:


B.S. + 15 years in information systems, business systems, management information systems, IT management, government contracting, engineering, math, or science.



Flexible work from home options available.

Perform operational requirement analysis to improve information technology and processes

Apply change, risk, and resource management

The ability to apply architectural principles to business solutions

Job Title: Watch Operations Analyst (Associate) - Cyber & Critical Infrastructure
Job Description:
Watch Operations Analyst (Associate) - Cyber & Critical Infrastructure

Arlington, VA
WI04-001-09 /
Top Secret
/ On-Site

At phia we hire talented and passionate people who are focused on collaborative, meaningful work, providing technical and operational subject matter expertise and support services to our partners and clients.

Watch Operations Analyst (Associate) - Cyber & Critical Infrastructure
Location: On-site in Arlington, VA (no remote/telework)

Are you passionate about national security and ready to play a pivotal role in defending critical cyber and physical infrastructure? We're seeking an Associate Watch Operations Analyst to join our team. This position is part of the DHS Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) Integrated Operations center, which coordinates situational awareness and response to vulnerabilities, threats, and incidents affecting our nation's cyber and critical infrastructure security.
This work is performed on-site in Arlington, VA and will support fixed shift operations (multiple shifts available).
What You'll Do
Maintain situational awareness of events, incidents, and reporting related to cybersecurity and critical infrastructure security.
Assist with cyber and physical incident coordination and draft and produce various levels reporting; analysts gather information from multiple sources and varying levels of classification, to provide accurate, timely, and actionable information to our government leadership, law enforcement, federal stakeholders, and partners.
Provide initial triage and analysis of cyber, communications and physical incidents to identify the severity of impact to critical infrastructure to determine the level of reporting or briefing required, coordinate incident operational data collection and analysis, and monitor and update status reporting on the event through completion.
Monitor open-source/unclassified/classified reporting channels, incident/ticket management systems, subscription-based alerting services, cable and local news, social media, and other sources for threats to the nation’s critical infrastructure and global operations impacting national security.
Understand the operation of all communications and information technology utilized to perform daily functions.
Follow approved work instructions and standard operating procedures, advise on updates to existing procedures, and draft new procedures as tasks and functions evolve.
Other services and support as needed or directed by the government client.
Work in a 24x7x365 operations center, and are expected to be willing to occasionally work different hours to cover for colleagues' absences.
Education + Requirements
3 years of related technical/operational experience OR Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 1 year related technical/operational experience.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills (this position is heavily focused around communication and coordination), with broad experience in lightweight research and analysis, and a heavy focus on knowledge synthesis and management.
Must be comfortable working in a time-sensitive, detail-orientated, fast-paced 24x7x365 operational environment; must be able to multitask, make quick decisions and utilize critical thinking skills to deal with new/unexpected situations.
Have the ability to read technical reporting on cybersecurity and operational technology and incidents, and be able to extract important information to provide clear and concise summary reporting for a non-technical audience.
Security Clearance
U.S. Citizenship required.
Active Top Secret U.S. government security clearance required.
In addition, a selected candidate must be able to meet and maintain DHS personnel vetting requirements.
Desired
Experience in 24x7 operational environments (e.g. Network Operations Centers, Security Operations Centers, Joint Operations Centers, Fusion Centers, etc.).
Experience in drafting and publishing situational awareness / status reporting and briefing organization leadership on recent events and current status.
Experience with information management, coordination, and collaboration across large enterprises and multiple communities of interest.
Experience with Federal and/or DHS policy and organizational structure around critical infrastructure (HSPD-7, NIPP, etc.).
Experience with workflow management systems such as Remedy and ServiceNow
Related cybersecurity certifications (e.g. CompTIA Security+, ISC2 CISSP, etc.)
Familiarity with cybersecurity concepts such as:
Vulnerabilities, exposure, and vulnerability management (CVE, CWE, etc.),
Threats, threat actors, and threat intelligence (including IOCs and TTPs),
Exploits and various types of malicious software (malware, ransomware, etc.), and
Incident and event reporting, analysis, escalation, response, and management.
#LI-LC1

Who You Are
A proactive problem solver that appreciates the challenges of working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Intellectually curious with a genuine desire to learn and advance your career.
An effective communicator, both verbally and in writing.
Customer service oriented and mission focused.

About the Opportunity:

As Director of Pricing Strategy, you will own creating and executing Ellucian’s pricing and packaging roadmap for a global portfolio of product and service offerings. You will partner cross-functionally to understand customer needs and market dynamics and will use data-driven research to craft a cohesive monetization strategy. This is a high visibility role requiring significant interaction with the field, cross functional teams, and executive leadership. This role will report to the Vice President of Financial Planning & Analysis.
Where you will make an impact

Create and own the pricing roadmap, and evolve the roadmap based on emerging business needs and stakeholder feedback.
Collaborate extensively with sales, finance, marketing and product teams on developing and implementing competitive pricing strategies and discount guidance.
Manage and drive major initiatives inclusive of customer willingness-to-pay research, pricing for new products, localized price lists across geographies, and thoughtful price changes for existing offerings.
Analyze sales trends and drivers of win/loss rates, churn/renewal rates, and incentives/promotions effectiveness to improve sales effectiveness and increase revenue through optimized pricing/bundling.
Collaborate with Finance and Product to conduct margin analyses and identify adjustments to pricing strategies to drive bottom-line growth.
Own quoting process, pricing data, and product catalog data; drive enhancements to pricing & billing operations
Leverage strong relationships across the executive team and business unit leadership to improve speed and impact of pricing decisions that will drive margin.
Grow and lead a high-performing team that will support your pricing & packaging strategy. Instill a culture that emphasizes speed, credibility, and innovation across the company.

What you will bring

Resourceful, go-getter personality. Business ownership, outcomes-oriented mentality
Experience in a B2B pricing role and/or direct experience developing business analytics and reporting, business cases, or related statistical analysis (e.g., Regression, Market Basket Analysis)
Industry experience in Software as a Service or Cloud-based software, internet, or data/ information services businesses is highly desired
Expertise using Microsoft Excel to aggregate disparate data sources, develop models, perform what-if analyses, and communicate key results. Comfort with large data sets required
Experience working with statistical tools such as SQL, R, Python/Pandas and MS Excel preferred.
Experience with Salesforce.com and Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) technologies a plus
Demonstrated experience in contributing to meaningful business analysis and proving associated impact
Strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to adapt style based on audience
Solid organizational skills with ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities

People in Corporate Functions contribute to the running of Accenture as a high- performance business through specialization within a specific functional area, and grow into internally focused roles by deepening their skills and/or developing new skills within an internal functional area.

Role: Security Operations Center (SOC) Senior Analyst (Crisis Coordinator)


This role is onsite in San Antonio, TX. Candidate must be open to relocate to San Antonio.

Job Description:


The Security Operations Center (SOC) Senior Analyst will be responsible for assessing, analyzing, and responding to incidents related to safety and security around the globe. The role requires daily use of tools/systems (e.g. access control, video management, risk feeds) to detect impact to Accenture’s people, products, property, or brand image and alert the appropriate response stakeholders. Specifically, incidents may range from extreme weather conditions, political instability, crime, terror, civil unrest, and other personnel issues. In addition, the Analyst will be responsible for customer service tasks to provide critical information and assistance to travelers, static employees, and potential third parties. This role will be based in San Antonio, Texas and reports to the SOC Shift Supervisor.

Key Responsibilities:

Assist company employees in all concerns that pertain to safety, security, and property

Act as initial point of contact to aid all employees, travelers, and others contacting the SOC

Monitor and operate security systems to include access control and CCTV, along with environmental monitoring and mass notification systems

Respond quickly and initiate action related to alarms, phone calls, and environmental monitoring and alerting systems

Notify, assist, and direct external emergency personnel and internal resources as necessary

Dispatch security officers or law enforcement personnel for alarm response, calls for service and emergency situations

Execute protocols and communicate at all levels across the globe to employees, site security leads, safety & security staff or contracted officers as needed

Manage information flow to and from an incident

Maintain operational logs, conduct daily shift checklists, handover reports, and incident reports

Ensure all forms of communications, such as e-mails, phone conversations, and client interactions, are conducted in a courteous and professional manner, confidentially, and documented appropriately

Coordinate with Accenture’s Corporate Security regional leads on incident detection and management

Ensure that complete and accurate information is entered in the incident management system

Utilize and execute protocols and standard operating procedures to effectively manage global incidents

Monitor travel safety and security of company's staff

Maintain situational awareness of current global current events

Monitor and respond to global alerts and events effecting company facilities and employees providing immediate information and assistance as needed

Initiate mass communication notifications as required

Notify leadership of events effecting business operations and employees

Ensure proper handling of highly confidential information

Perform other duties assigned by supervisors related to security and safety


Location:

The role is located in San Antonio, TX and requires to be in the office.


Hours & Shift Requirements:

Night Shift (11:00pm - 7:00 am CST) - Note - This is a 24/7 operations center and critical to have flexibility to work any shift required as needed to support the business


Training:

Individuals receive paid training


Travel:

No travel is needed for this position




Basic Qualifications:

Associate degree or minimum of 2 years of security work experience in Military, Law Enforcement, Government, Corporate Security, Customer Service, Communications or Academia


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience identifying anomalies in a physical environment and performing first-line investigations

Experience with emergency response protocols & processes

Bachelor’s degree in Business, International Relations, Political Science, Communications, or other Humanities-related degrees

Minimum 1-year experience in a Security Operation or Command Center role

Bilingual (English/Spanish/Portuguese)

Experience with Genetec video solutions or CCure 9000

Proficient in Microsoft Windows and Office Suite

Ability to analyze threats and envision potential or real time impact to operations

Ability to respond quickly and calmly to emergencies and stressful situations exercising proper judgment and decision-making skills

Professional skills:

Great active listening skills

Rapport building skills

Patient and empathetic attitude

Adaptability and flexibility

Strong Customer Service skills

Strong consensus, team building and negotiating skills

Ability to work overtime on short notice

Strong cultural sensitivities

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to multitask in a fast-paced, at times stressed work environment

Strong team player

Comfortable with high-tech work environment, and constant learning of new tools and innovations

Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian

Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian
