What is the Role?

Solution Architects will join the implementation team at Gerent who shares our vision of bringing the power of cloud computing to enterprises. Solution Architects are experienced professionals on our project teams accountable for solution design of composable business processes and or contributing to end to end solution designs. They are accountable for designing solutions and writing build tickets of medium and complex functionality. They work closely with various technical and non-technical team members, managing and running more complex, enterprise and strategic technical projects. The solution architect partners with other architects and consultants to ensure proposed or built solutions will drive the desired business outcomes.


They are a senior resource, taking ownership of understanding how Salesforce products can be leveraged to meet desired business outcomes. They have a deep curiosity and can explore the “why” behind how our customers work. They possess strong business analysis and technical skills, taking an empathetic approach to customer conversations.


The Solution Architect will have the opportunity to grow into an Enterprise Architect. Gerent pays for all the examination vouchers for any Salesforce certifications and ensures you have the time to prepare and pass the certification exams.


Responsibilities:
Serve as a Trusted Advisor, drive conversations with our customer's Enterprise Architects and Business Stakeholders armed with best practices for enterprise architecture functions such as Security, Performance, Development Process, and Application Governance
Advise and mentor diverse teams, which include customer and partner resources in technical and functional delivery aspects at a project level, using influence and adaptive communication strategies in scenarios where Senior Architect does not have direct authority over all resources.
Accountable for the design and implementation of Salesforce solutions that meet business requirements for midsize to enterprise projects including tactical, program and strategic projects
Present solution options to customer, evaluating the pros and cons of declarative configuration against code and customization
Provide guidance on application and integration development best practices, Enterprise Architecture standards, functional and technical solution architecture & design, environment management, testing, and Force. com Platform education.

Document solution narratives.

Understanding business requirements gathered and leading technical discovery sessions with clients

Contribute to the growth of the Services Practice by identifying and leading internal strategic initiatives to grow the consulting practice, leveraging junior teammates to achieve individual as well as team growth; serving as an active contributor to the practice knowledge and resource base; mentor, educate, and enrich technical and non-technical Salesforce customer and partner colleagues
Manage a team of Senior Solution Consultants (4) and mentor Technical BAs

Superb writing, communication and presentation skills

At Gerent, we recognize that our people are our strongest asset. Relationships are our gold standard.

Constantly striving for excellence.

Doing the right thing.

We keep our moral compass close at hand. We strive to do the right thing in every situation, no matter how big or small.


We’re always looking for talented professionals who can help make our company — and team — stronger and more capable. Apply today!

Advana/Business Analyst Professionals will support the development and implementation of the Advana Data Analytics platform in the U.S. Army, U.S. Air Force and other DoD components. Staff member(s) will:




Utilize strong technical and analytical skills to normalize finance and accounting data from multiple sources to support Department of Defense (DoD) audit readiness and delivery;
Use expertise in DoD financial management, internal controls, audit readiness, and project management, develop and implement solutions for the DoD’s complex financial reporting and audit challenges.
Leverage understanding of common data model design, data acquisition and ingestion, and the application development lifecycle to bridge gaps between technologists and defense financial managers, ensuring software solutions meet audit priorities.



You’ll work closely with DoD customers to understand their data challenges and requirements, digging into their data-rich environments to identify the key pieces of their financial reporting puzzles. Lead stakeholder interviews and fact-finding efforts, develop business rules for customer data sets, build reconciliations to support completeness validations, generate responses to auditor requests, and standardize the DoD’s approach to audit response.




You’ll provide your customers with structured solutions for responding to DoD Inspector General, independent public accountant, and internal audit inquiries. As a Data Analyst, you will contribute to the transformation and consolidation of disparate data sets, building databases, metrics, dashboards, and applications to support audit preparation and management decision-making.




This position is of interest to professionals with a DoD audit readiness and/or DoD accounting/FM background who want to work with advanced technology and software solutions that support DoD FM transformation.




Required Skills

5+ years of DoD or Fortune 500 experience in the areas of financial reporting, audit, internal controls, FIAR/ audit readiness and/or data analysis;
Knowledge of the USSGL chart of accounts, USSGL account transactions, Treasury Federal Account Symbols and Titles (FAST), DoD Financial Management Regulation (FMR), Generally Accepted Government Auditing Standards (GAGAS), OMB Circular A-123, and other related guidance
Experience acquiring accounting data, building databases, generating audit samples, and responding to provided by client (PBC) requests
BA, BS or BBA degree in accounting, finance, business management, statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, or related area
CPA, CGFM, CDFM, CISA, CIA or other related designation (preferred but not required)
Preferred: Experience with Scrum Agile development; integrating of databases; utilizing BI platforms to create dashboards and reports; experience with relational databases
Excellent written and oral communication skills with a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain outstanding client relationships



Other experience which is helpful

Experience with DoD financial statement audit process, and FIAR audit processes including audit liaison
Experience with modern relational databases, including MySQL or PostgreSQL
Experience with Big Data systems (e.g., Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, Cloudera)
Experience providing recommendations using dashboards, visualizations, or reports using BI platforms such as QlikSense or Tableau
Ability to manipulate and integrate databases with SQL, SAS, or other languages
Ability to comprehend stakeholder needs effectively, communicate development plans, and track progress milestones
Possession of excellent communication skills, including briefing senior leadership
Possession of excellent quantitative skills, including statistical analysis, process design, and data management



Requires Active Secret clearance




Hybrid position in Washington DC metro area

Overview:
Systems Planning and Analysis, Inc. (SPA) delivers high-impact, technical solutions to complex national security issues. With over 50 years of business expertise and consistent growth, we are known for continuous innovation for our government customers, in both the US and abroad. Our exceptionally talented team is highly collaborative in spirit and practice, producing Results that Matter. Come work with the best! We offer opportunity, unique challenges, and clear-sighted commitment to the mission. SPA: Objective. Responsive. Trusted.

The Industry and Security Analysis Group (ISAG) supports a range of customer organizations with the Office of the Secretary of Defense. ISAG has a near-term opening for an experienced Foreign Investment Business Intelligence Analyst. This position will be onsite in Arlington, VA or the Mark Center in Alexandria, VA.
Responsibilities:
The Business Intelligence Analyst will provide business intelligence, economic, and market analysis in support of DoD initiatives. The candidate will integrate subject matter expertise and market analysis, leveraging business intelligence tools to connect large diverse data sources from government, commercial and open sources, to empower decisions that ensure robust, innovative, affordable, and technologically superior defense industrial capabilities today and in the future. The candidate will support ASD IBP in the identification, analysis, and tracking of foreign investments in the Defense Industrial Base (DIB). In addition, the candidate will help track foreign investment risk and deliver recommendations to the government client on how to best address that risk. The candidate shall also develop and maintain standard procedures for identifying, analyzing, and tracking foreign investment in the DIB.
Qualifications:
Required:
Bachelor's degree in the areas of Business, Finance, or Economics (or related)
5+ years of experience in global markets, industry/sector trends, capital formation, banking or intelligence analysis
Ability to research complex economic topics on short notice and to develop concise, informative products for senior leaders
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Top Secret clearance

Desired:
Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or Economics
Military or commercial business intelligence experience
Active TS/SCI

Collaborate with stakeholders and other cross-functional team members (Developers, Functional Analysts, and Testers) to produce scalable, efficient, and supportable solutions utilizing Oracle and related technologies

Provide Tier 2/3 end-user support

Experience with maintenance support of Oracle EBS R12 Federal Financials, including Procure to Pay (P2P), Budget to Report (B2R), Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM), Acquire to Retire (A2R), and Order to Cash (O2C)
Working knowledge of DoD procurement, receiving, and invoicing policies and procedures

Team player with the ability to adjust to a dynamic working environment that supports a government agency
Strong written, verbal and listening skills
Knowledge and experience in developing software using agile methodologies.


What We Can Offer You:


We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.


Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.


We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.


We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.


For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

Manager, Product Manager - Consumer Identity

Product Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you


In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing


Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

In your role, you will:


Consumer Identity is looking for a Product Manager to join the customer facing Authentication team. Capital One has taken the bold initiative to position itself as a trusted leader and authoritative service provider of consumer authentication and secure identity management. You will manage a sprint team to ship, scale, and improve products that delight our customers and position our company for substantial growth. You’ll define product direction and prioritization of features, actively manage a backlog, make trade off decisions, and clear impediments for your team in the customer facing identity space.


In this position you will be responsible to innovate and ensure Capital One is providing industry leading technology and experiences in the Consumer Identity sector. In addition, you will be part of the team that is transforming how our systems work as Consumer Identity transitions to a platform based organization.


Own the success and life cycle of features for your product and/or platform, setting its strategy and driving prioritization decisions toward improvements. You will test and learn your way to something new while taking into account business strategy, market analysis, user feedback, analytics and technology best practices.


Collaborate with internal partners. You will rally your team to deliver your vision while participating in relevant governance and risk forums and building strong relationships with diverse stakeholders. You will also help us nurture relationships with key external stakeholders in the Consumer Identity industry including academics, entrepreneurs, and leading identity companies. You will be a key team member in enabling relationships with external pilot partners.


Learn from your network of developers, designers, analysts, data scientists, customers and other subject-matter experts and leverage them to build cutting-edge products.


We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

InnovaSystems is seeking a senior level BSA-SME with the ability to perform exceptional data analysis and detailed requirements building supporting United States Space Force readiness reporting objectives for FY23 and beyond. The senior BSA-SME will:

Provide guidance and actively participate in requirements reviews, client support, testing and everyday readiness analysis in support of Space readiness assets
Research and capture business needs and act as a proxy for the users and customers by interfacing directly with developers, subject matter experts, stakeholders, and testers to ensure the end-state functionality is acceptable in fulfilling the identified customer value
On the data side, will work with appropriate organizations to identify relevant data sources as the primary liaison for Memorandums of Understanding/Memorandum of Agreement

As a key member of the team, the BSA-SME will be required to analyze data for inconsistencies such as missing/bad data and support complex queries from data source partners or customers. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are needed for success in regular meetings with senior military officers involved in plans, policy, training management, and readiness assessment.

Effective written and oral communication skills a must
Ability to train readiness at multiple levels: leadership, MAJCOMs, Wings, Unit Commanders, Unit Admins, etc.
Ability to communicate with customers, stakeholders, and an agile software development team
Proficiency in MS Office Suite a must
Strong organizational, time management, and meeting facilitation skills

Knowledge of METL/SORTS readiness reporting policy
Expertise in current readiness reporting (to include UTC reporting) efforts strongly recommended

Company Name: American Academy of Physician Associates Inc
Job Description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE:

Under the direction of the CIO, the AMS Administrator will be responsible for the administration of the organization’s Association Management System (AMS) - Aptify from Community Brands, and related applications. The AMS Administrator will serve as the in-house AMS ecosystem expert for AAPA staff. Their primary responsibility will be the health and integrity of the AMS and its data. This will come in the form of a wide range of tasks including identifying and implementing AMS best practices, researching, and assisting with AMS upgrades/enhancements, documenting data dictionary and data standards, and establishing reporting protocols. In addition, the AMS Administrator should be comfortable performing project manager and business analyst functions and coordinating work with external contractors/vendors as necessary.

Reports to: Chief Information Officer (CIO)

RESPONSIBILITIES:

AMS Management and maintenance:
Manage day-to-day functionality and maintenance of AAPA’s AMS to include proactive improvements to operations, functionality, and reporting capabilities.
Monitor scheduled AMS jobs and scripts for successful execution.
Assist with implementation and launch of other add-on products and support development of interfaces as required.
Maintain source code catalog and data dictionary.
Develop, implement, administer, and maintain AMS policies and procedures for general staff and IT staff to ensure the integrity and security of the data.
Optimize the use of the AMS across the organization by staying current on upcoming enhancements and functionality of the application.
Maintain protocols for:
preventing data duplication
removing obsolete data or records
handling incomplete data and resolving bad data systemically
Enforce AAPA data entry standards; train staff on procedures and monitor compliance.
Ensure data integrity on the production and test environments.
Plan, schedule, and implement system upgrades and/or enhancements in the Aptify ecosystem.
Analyze and resolve complex AMS system bugs and issues.
Analyze and implement functional enhancement requests from business stakeholders.
Supervise IT Coordinator FTE. Assign and oversee AMS related tasks and provide training and support where required.
Engage in Aptify communities and learning opportunities to keep current on Aptify and AMS knowledge and trends.

Reporting:
Create and modify reports for staff utilizing views.
Identify processes and procedures, as well as develop scripts for data cleansing and formatting.
Upload and download large volumes of data on a routine basis.
Oversee and maintain a catalog of internal reports and forms

Technology Projects:
Provide project management and oversight of Aptify development and integration deliverables provided by 3rd party contractors.
Support ongoing integrations with other third-party products including interfacing with the AAPA website, learning management system, community engagement platform, and eCommerce platform.

Training:
Conduct individual and group training on the Aptify application and other related software tools to staff to ensure consistent and appropriate usage of the software.
Develop training materials as necessary to support hands-on training.

Business Analysis
Provide business analysis expertise to support development and adoption of new programs or enhancements to existing programs that require the support of the AMS system.
Lead discovery and requirements definition.
Formulate solution, employing the support of internal IT and external vendor resources as needed.
Configure Aptify and/or oversee development of solution.
Perform testing to confirm satisfaction of requirements.
Conduct rollout of new functionality to business units.

QUALIFICATIONS:


Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field required.
Demonstrated prior experience managing an enterprise application.
Minimum 2 years related experience administering Aptify
Expert knowledge of reporting tools such as Crystal Reports and SSRS.
Proficient in relational database concepts, validation, permissions, and querying. Working knowledge of operating systems and database maintenance.
Ability to write and debug SQL queries is preferred.
Able to complete tasks and duties on time with little supervision; prioritizing workload and effectively balancing responsibilities.
Detail oriented, logical, and meticulous
Adept at working in a team environment. Gets along well with others, has win as a team mindset, eager to help others.
Willing to work various hours and days when necessary.
Skills in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with AAPA members and staff

Position Title
Director of Data Analytics


Unit Mission Statement
William & Mary Information Technology (W&M IT) provides a reliable, flexible and secure technological environment that enables swift and skilled solutions for rapidly changing needs to advance teaching, learning, research, student success and operational efficiency. By developing and nurturing meaningful relationships and collaborations on campus and beyond, W&M IT engages, inspires and empowers community members to achieve their goals. We develop expertise, promote self-service and encourage experimentation while working to drive relevant and sustainable change.


Position Summary
The Director of Data Analytics is responsible for leading the design, development, and implementation of W&M data initiatives and projects that expand analytics, visualization, reporting, and data management capabilities in support of decision-making at all levels. The Director will lead a Data Architecture team that defines technical strategy and implementation of data assets and capabilities with a focus on Architecture, Data Governance and Quality efforts, and optimization of Data Pipelines.

Reporting to the Chief Data Officer, this position holds a key leadership role on the Information Technology Data Management team and works collaboratively on division and university-wide initiatives, planning efforts, and operational support of core analytics and data management capabilities.

Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
Work closely with university colleagues to provide creative, data-driven visualizations and insights on key performance indicators and drive data consistency across W&M departments.
Implement projects that achieve university objectives and drives organizational alignment and improves data quality.
Manage a team of analysts and a developer who facilitate the requirements gathering, design, development, delivery, documentation, policies and procedures and support of reporting and analytic solutions.
Manage staff in their day-to-day performance.
Work across W&M teams to align resources and responsibilities related to university business intelligence capabilities and products.


Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of education, training, and or experience.
Experience directly related to the position demonstrating increased responsibility, leadership, and specialized expertise over time.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the proven ability to solve highly complex and technical issues efficiently with a focus on achieving practical results.
Strong organizational skills with the demonstrated ability to manage multiple relationships and projects in a deadline-driven environment while effectively managing resources to address competing priorities.
Practical knowledge of information architecture, and one or more areas of data management (analytics, reporting methodologies, warehousing, storage, security, integration, mastering, governance, analysis, modeling), and project management.
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex technical information to non-technical audiences.
Outstanding interpersonal and collaboration skills with a strong customer service focus.


Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in a technology role, focused on providing business analysis and data management and governance practices.
Experience implementing or working with the Ellucian suite and/or other enterprise-wide systems. (Examples: Banner, Salesforce, Slate, Blackbaud, Learning Management Tools).
Experience using programming languages like SQL, R, Python.
Experience with use of one or more enterprise reporting tools, preferably Qlik, SAS, PowerBI or Tableau.

$100,000, commensurate with experience

Intelligence Operations Analyst (IOC 24/7)
R0103814
Fort Belvoir, Virginia, United States
Full time
Add to favorites Favorited View favorites

Amentum is seeking an experienced Watch Shift Intelligence Operations Analyst to support an upcoming contract at Fort Belvoir in Virginia.

Essential Responsibilities:

Maintain 24/7 mission command capability for the INSCOM Leadership.
Serve as the single focal point for the interface between HQ INSCOM, its MSCs, supported units and organizations, DoD, AOC, and Intelligence Community.
Respond to general inquiries from SIL, INSCOM G-3 Directorate leadership, IMCC leadership (e.g., G-3, Deputy and SGM of Operations, G-3/3 Current Operations Chief, Deputy, and NCOIC, Regional Desk Officers, and IMCC Chief and Deputy), the COR, or higher Government authority.
Effectively apply critical thinking methodologies and processes in resolving complex problems, conducting analysis, development, production and delivery of products; to include, responding appropriately to Requests for Information (RFIs), drafting EXSUMS, information papers, briefings and presenting oral presentations.
Prepare and conduct Shift Change Briefs/Updates.
Provide summary/EXSUM of Shift Change key points to the Senior IMCC Operations and Intelligence Support / Senior Intelligence and Operations Analyst/Site Lead and the COR.
Monitor news media outlets for situational awareness, specifically for worldwide news reports that may impact INSCOM and Army equities. Maintain continuous surveillance of the world situation for items of interest to the INSCOM or ARSTAFF and report using the appropriate means (e.g. EXSUM, log entry, email, etc.) IAW established SOPs and Battle Drills.
Monitor NIPRNET, SIPRNET, and JWICS networks for worldwide and national events, both natural and manmade, that have an impact on the INSCOM organization or INSCOM operations. This includes, but is not limited to, earthquakes, hurricanes, bombings, active shooters, and military attacks. Initiate coordination with appropriate staff directorate and draft an INSCOM response IAW established SOPs and Battle Drills.
Monitor, track, and disseminate Theater Significant Activities (SIGACTS), SIPR, NIPR, and the Automated Message Handling System (AMHS) for Serious Incident Reports (SIR), OPREP-3s, and other messages that meet HQDA Senior Leader Critical Command Information Requirement (CCIR) criteria or may impact INSCOM elements. Take appropriate actions IAW IMCC/IMCC SOP or Battle Drills.
Monitor message traffic across NIPRNET, SIPRNET, and JWICS networks for immediate notification requirements for the INSCOM G-3 to satisfy requests for information (RFI) from CCMD intelligence elements, MSCs, the Army Cyber Command, and the AOC.
Receive, summarize, disseminate, track, and archive all INSCOM Serious Incident Reports (SIRs), outages and all Shift activities IAW IMCC SOP or IMCC Knowledge Enterprise protocols.
Disseminate, track, and archive all published HQDA Execution Orders (EXORD), Fragmentary Orders (FRAGOS), and Warning Orders (WARNOS) IAW IMCC SOP or IMCC Knowledge Enterprise procedures.
Receive orders for publication from G-33 Orders Production Cell or other Government personnel designated in writing by the COR to the contractor and disseminate orders in accordance with established INSCOM IMCC SOP.
Forward all HQDA Operations Briefs and selected JS Briefs via NIPR, SIPR or JWICS networks with the appropriate classification and caveats, by using the assigned distribution list. Additionally, post HQDA and JS Briefs to the IMCC Knowledge Enterprise (e.g., IMCC Dashboard(s), BUB, Read-books, Highlights, and COP), or any other locations that the COR, or other Government personnel designated in writing by the COR to the contractors deems appropriate.
Compile and disseminate the CG and Senior staff daily-read books.
Receive and disseminate all (DTRA) Treaty messages to appropriate MSC(s), via email to the greatest extent possible, using appropriate HQDA protocols for responding to inquiries. Log the event, critical information, and distribution contacts/list into the IMCC Watch portal log.
Update and maintain the current list of CCIRs from the CCDRs.
Synchronize IMCC operations and intelligence reporting in support of current, emergency, and crisis events.
Conduct analysis of operational requirements stemming from messages, plans, and orders issued by the Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS), HQDA, or Commanding General, INSCOM. Provide draft recommendations or response to the COR, or other Government personnel designated in writing by the COR to the contractor.
Maintain and update the INSCOM Common Operation Picture (COP), to include information pertaining to INSCOM's global deployments, disposition of forces and capabilities, INSCOM's support to global operations (steady state and contingency), global hotspots, and named and emerging areas of interest.
Prepare and conduct daily executive level Battle Update Briefs, generally at 0800 Fort Belvoir, VA local time; unless an alternate time is arranged. The purpose of these BUB activities is to provide timely, relevant information regarding INSCOM global intelligence operations to INSCOM senior leaders and serve as an action- officer level exchange of information for matters of cross-staff interest or requiring cross-staff coordination
Develop products to include presentations, briefings, information papers, and executive summaries utilizing tools to include Google Earth, Arc GIS, Microsoft Office Suite, and the embedded suite of intelligence analysis tools within DCGS-A.

Requirements:

Current DoD Top Secret / SCI Security Clearance
Bachelor’s degree in any discipline.
10-15 years Army or Joint All Source Intelligence experience
Completion of MICCC, WOAC or ALC.
Demonstrated experience as a staff member at Battalion or higher level
Experience as a primary staff officer, primary staff section NCOIC or primary staff section warrant officer is preferred.
Experience with all-source intelligence processes, data evaluation, and analysis.
Demonstrated experience delivering global situational awareness in support of planning, synchronization, decision making and execution of client missions using automated systems.
Demonstrated experience with intelligence automated systems.
Working knowledge of the Operational Production, Exploitation, and Dissemination Experience.
Demonstrated experience managing research and coordination for projects.
Experience working with and maintaining databases.

Job Description

HII-Mission Technologies is seeking a skilled, knowledgeable, and highly motivated Military Operations Analyst for the Requirements Contract Team within the Joint Training Synthetic Environment (JTSE)-Alion Program in support of the Joint Staff J7 (JS J7) Deputy Director Joint Training (DD JT) Environment Operations Division (EOD).

Provide extremely high-level subject matter expertise regarding Combatant Command (CCMD) and other Joint exercises.
Maintain a working knowledge of the JS J7 Joint Warfighting Concept and apply the concepts to gathering, analyzing, and managing operational training gaps and associated solutions in support of JLVC Modernization.

Assess the impact of programmatic and technical options on validated Service joint training gaps.
Prepare reports and briefs summarizing emerging requirements, scheduled capability development, and investments for Joint and Service joint training programs.
Plan, coordinate, facilitate, and document several JS J7 DD JT coordination boards, working groups, and planning teams that support and advance the joint training community of interest and capability development efforts.
Design and prepare reports, papers, and related documentation; organize information and record results using collaborative tools on the Defense Intelligence Information Enterprise (DI2E) such as Jira and Confluence; and prepare and deliver presentations and briefings for senior leaders and managers.

Gerent is on the lookout for a driven Sales Director who possess the grit and energy to help us grow and scale. The Sales Director is responsible for leadership and support throughout the customer engagement and solution implementation lifecycle. They are accountable for identifying and driving new opportunities with new and existing nonprofit customers to meet revenue quota/targets.


They are an experienced sales leader in the nonprofit industry and have experience selling technology solutions. They are strategic thinkers who taps into the motivations of our customers to carve out the right engagement that will meet their needs. They possess business analysis and critical thinking skills. They work closely with pre-sales, delivery experts and industry experts in order to effectively shape a deal.


What you’ll do:


Work with Salesforce sales leaders as well as prospect and existing clients to identify, nurture and develop opportunities. You will own the opportunity and adhere to our sales processes including entering data into our Salesforce instance. You will be responsible for working closely with the Gerent presales and industry teams to bring the right solution and proposal forward to customers ensuring both our customer, internal and salesforce timelines are being met. You will nurture relationships with Salesforce teams assigned which can include team building and enablement events in order to help drive pipeline.

Develop and execute a sales plan to grow business for Gerent’s nonprofit services.

Build and develop relationships with Salesforce account executives and leadership in your assigned territory and leverage our differentiated value to drive partner-referral based lead flow.
Manage the end to end sales cycle by understanding our prospective clients' challenges and framing solutions to them leveraging both our people and Salesforce technology. You’ll quarterback our resources and bring the business context to our proposed solutions. Our typical cycles involve:
Initial Client Introductions and Need Assessments
Scoping conversations (Pre-Sales led)
Solutions Proposals
Statements of Work
T’s and C’s negotiation
Collaborate closely and effectively with our Practice leadership, Pre-Sales, Delivery Team Members and support teams.
Ensure we successfully transition projects to our delivery team setting them up for success with our clients.

Maintain executive alignment and the Gerent relationship with our clients as our teams deliver projects for them and identify future work together.

What we’re looking for:

5+ years of consulting and systems integration sales experience, nonprofit sales experience or sales management experience

Experience selling to and building strong relationships with C level executives
Experience selling collaboratively in teams and with other organizations in complex deal cycles
Strong communication skills and a high level of empathy
Solid judgment and problem-solving skills
Experience working with internal and external partners through complex sales cycles
Preferred experience with large scale technology projects
Preferred experience working with technical and creative project teams

Approximately 30 percent travel may be required.

What we can offer you:

Competitive salary

WFH
FTO
Paid major holidays
Healthcare, dental, vision coverage

401k

Don’t wait; start growing your career with Gerent today!


At Gerent, we recognize that our people are our strongest asset. Since our founding, we’ve sought to harness the power of people and technology to fuel meaningful, positive connections between businesses and consumers. Our thriving community of creative thinkers and makers sets us apart by continually finding new ways to turn innovative technology solutions into remarkable customer experiences.


The quality of their collective work speaks for itself — today, Gerent stands as a Salesforce Summit Partner and, after 900+ implementations, holds a 5-Star Customer Satisfaction Score. Our services span the gamut from strategy to consulting, implementation, digital experience, innovation, and managed services.


Our ultimate goal is to become a trusted advisor in the Salesforce ecosystem. To that end, we’ve gathered some of the best and brightest in tech to ensure that Gerent’s collective strategic knowledge, business acumen, industry knowledge, and deep technical expertise set us apart from our competitors.
We’ve built a solid foundation over the past 13 years. Now, we have a pivotal opportunity to expand exponentially over the next few years. We need talented professionals who can help us grow — and want to grow alongside us.


Why work with Gerent?

Relationships are our gold standard.

We put our people first because we know the way we treat our employees is the way they’ll treat our customers.

Learning never stops.

Our team has an unquenchable thirst for knowledge. We embrace curiosity and continuous learning, pushing ourselves to skill up and stay abreast of industry and technical innovations.

Working to live.

Work is just one facet of a person’s life, and we intend to keep it that way. That’s why our entire team works remotely – because we’ve found that working from home means having more time to spend on our passions and with our families.

Embracing our differences.

Diversity is one of our greatest strengths. By including people from all walks of life, we can generate the best ideas and solutions.

We see and seek the best in people.

We assume the best of those we work with. We’ve found that assuming positive intent from our clients and colleagues leads to a positive work environment where everyone thrives.

Greater than the sum of our parts.

We believe we’re at our best when we work together. We’ve created a culture in which team members come together and elevate one another to perform at a higher standard than they ever could alone.

Constantly striving for excellence.

When something is good, we want to make it great. It’s in our company DNA to challenge the status quo and push the envelope. We’re not afraid to ask hard questions that improve our work.

Doing the right thing.

We keep our moral compass close at hand. We strive to do the right thing in every situation, no matter how big or small.


We’re always looking for talented professionals who can help make our company — and team — stronger and more capable. Apply today!

Job Title: Operations Engineer / Analyst - Mission Engineering Study Team
Job Description:
Velos is a full-service engineering and technical services and government relations consulting firm representing leaders in the defense, aerospace, intelligence, and related industries. As an SBA-certified HUBZone company, Velos incorporates technical prowess into the execution of corporate strategies and business development experience, providing clients with reliable, cost effective, and maximum impact solutions. Velos also provides multi-discipline engineering and technical services to agencies such as NASA, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) and the Department of Defense (DoD).


Velos is seeking a senior level Operations Engineer / Analyst - Mission Engineering Study Team. This individual will be a Subject Matter Expert (SME), joining the team and serving as the senior operations analyst on a team of analysts, engineers and modelers conducting Mission Engineering studies for OUSD R&E in accordance with the Mission Engineering Guide (https://ac.cto.mil/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/MEG-v40_20201130_shm.pdf). You will produce objective insights and analytic justifications to inform future technology and capability investment decisions within the Planning, Programming, and Budgeting Execution (PPBE) process and aid in the prioritization, alignment and validation of requirements within Joint Capabilities Integration and Development System (JCIDS) to deliver modernized capabilities that enable an all-domain joint force aligned with future Joint Warfighting Concepts. This position will be located on site 5 days per week at the Mark Center in Alexandria, Virginia.

Your essential job functions will include but may not be limited to:

You will assist in developing the study plans, identifying needed resources (personnel, modeling tools, etc.), socializing the study with stakeholders, executing the study, and authoring the study final report.

Required Qualifications:

Minimum of 15 years relevant experience
Experience and understanding of the PPBE and JCIDS processes and military operational concepts

Desired Qualifications:

15+ years operational experience
Experience working in the Joint Staff.
Experience analyzing system solutions to complex and challenging DoD problems.
Experience defining operational problems within the fighting forces and using statistical analysis, simulations, predictive modeling, or other methods to analyze it and develop practical solutions.
Experience developing and executing analysis and study plans that address complex problems, examine trade-offs and sensitivities, and produce data and information rich products and artifacts.
Expertise in Joint Force design, development and application, operational constraints, concepts of operations, concepts of employment, development and execution of CCMD operation plans, threat tactics and responses, logistics approaches.
Expert-level experience in one or more of the following areas:
NC3
JADC2
C2BMC
Long-Range Fires
Space Operations
Position, Navigation and Timing
ISR
Theater-level Logistics planning/support
IAMD/Base Defense

Education Requirements:

Bachelors Degree.
Bachelors Degree from War College or equivalent, in a recognized discipline that is relevant - Desired.
Masters Degree in Operations Research or Engineering - Desired.

Certification Requirements:

Certificate from advanced Professional Military Education relevant to Military Training and/or Military Planning.

Clearance Requirements:

Current / Active TS with SCI eligibility. Subject to a Counterintelligence (CI) polygraph.
U.S. Citizenship is required for this position.


Velos (VEE-los), meaning "arrow" in Greek, truly symbolizes who we are as a company. We provide the perfect combination of agile, highly talented engineering and technical support with decades of market analysis and strategic planning experience - providing invaluable capabilities from strategy development through program execution. Whether we are leading an effort or part of a team, Velos always hits the mark!

Velos offers a competitive benefits package including PTO, 401K, and health benefits. We know our team is more than just the job we do, which is why we support education advancement with our tuition reimbursement program.


Velos is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

ACT1 Federal is seeking an individual experienced in military aviation operations and logistics to serve as an F-35 Logistics Capability Delivery (LCD) Operations Analyst in the F-35 Joint Program Office (JPO) located in Arlington (Crystal City), VA.

As an LCD Operations Analyst, you will assist the F-35 JPO LCD team in the management, coordination, planning, contracting, budgeting, scheduling, and tracking of significant facility/site activation events and deliverables required to get the F-35 operational for various countries and units around the world.

Scheduling and de-conflicting events, real-time assignment of traveling team composition, ensuring sufficient funding, monitoring event execution, and ensuring after-action activity completion
Managing obligation, expenditures, and routine reconciliation of team funds
Managing, cataloguing, and building Document Manager (DM) files to support future data management and data gathering activities

Minimum Qualifications:

BA/BS degree (An additional four (4) years of directly related work experience may be substituted for a Bachelor’s Degree)
Minimum of six (6) years of experience in military aviation operations or logistics fields
Demonstrated experience within military aviation operations, procurement, budget, or logistics environments
Possess knowledge of military aviation life cycle logistics infrastructure and processes
Familiar with Microsoft Office Program Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Project)
Secret Clearance

Desired:

Functional knowledge of project management methodologies
Knowledge of the principles, policies, and practices of system acquisition and systems engineering required to plan, organize, and manage critical aspects of the development, production, and deployment of systems, subsystems, and equipment
Knowledge of defense contracting
Master's degree or higher in systems management or a related technical field (can be substituted for two years of experience)
Level I DAWIA certification or equivalent

Job Title: IT Solution Manager, Pricing / Quotations Applications (remote with travel)
Job Description:
Here at Siemens, we take pride in enabling sustainable progress through technology. We do this through empowering customers by combining the real and digital worlds. Improving how we live, work, and move today and for the next generation! We know that the only way a business thrives is if our people are thriving. That’s why we always put our people first. Our global, diverse team would be happy to support you and challenge you to grow in new ways. Who knows where our shared journey will take you?

We are looking for an IT Solution Manager. This position can be remote from the east or central time zones with up to 30% travel.

You have an in-depth understanding of the Pricing and Quotation processes in B2B commerce and experience with implementing IT Solutions to support these processes. Experience with Salesforce platform and CPQ solutions is a significant plus. You can analyze complex processes, design and implement customized solutions to meet business requirements and provide domain expertise and CPQ to internal stakeholders. You will be driving implementations in North and South America for IT solutions in Pricing and Quotations as well as stable service operations for completed implementations.

This role will serve as a multifaceted techno-functional consultant and innovator in driving digital transformation for Sales and CPQ solutions. You will report to the Sr Director in corporate IT Sales CPQ organization unit and work closely with business stakeholders, end users and other technology professionals in a matrixed environment. In addition to deep technical and functional knowledge, you must have outstanding communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively across global teams.

Provide subject matter expertise on Salesforce platform based solutions to internal stakeholders.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, perform gap/fit and develop solutions to fit the requirements.
Lead the implementation of Salesforce platform based solutions, including CPQ and Sales Cloud.
Design and implement integrations with other Salesforce and non-Salesforce systems.
Engage with stakeholders and end-users to support continuous improvement and increase adoption.
Ensure the security, performance, and scalability of Salesforce solutions.
Mentor and train other members of the team on Salesforce best practices.
Stay up to date with the latest Salesforce Cloud releases and provide recommendations for new features and functionality.
Provide technical guidance and support to business project managers, developers, and end-users.
Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of Salesforce CPQ services, including coordination of implementation activities and service management.
Work with project managers and team members to develop and implement project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation.
Communicate regularly with stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects.

You will win us over by having the following qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Science, Business or Engineering.
7+ years of experience in IT solution design, implementation and service delivery of IT systems, especially for Pricing and Quotations applications.
Business Analyst or Consulting experience in Sales platforms and solutions.
Understanding of Salesforce suite of products, including Sales Cloud, Salesforce CPQ and related technologies is a significant plus.
Ability to lead implementations and service engagements in collaboration with technical teams offshore.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Experience with Agile tools and methodology
Ability to travel up to 30% domestic and international.
Preferred Qualifications:
Salesforce CPQ certification is a plus.
Consulting experience a plus.
Professional certifications (ITIL, PMP, Six Sigma, etc.) a plus.
Bilingual in Spanish, German or Portuguese, preferred.
Experience with LWC, Apex, Visualforce, and other Salesforce development tools is a plus.
You’ll benefit from:

Company Description


AETOS LLC is a Minority Owned CVE Certified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) providing information technology solutions focused on building a business that is customer-centered and performance-oriented. At Aetos, we specialize in developing IT solutions to optimize functionality and efficiencies for government and commercial clients to meet their business needs.



Job Description


Aetos LLC seeks a Microsoft Dynamics 365 Senior Finance Consultant to collaborate closely with our clients, providing guidance on leveraging the capabilities of Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) to achieve their business goals.

In this position, you will engage with our clients and collaborate alongside developers and project managers to delineate requirements, critically assess information, and formulate requirement specifications for the purpose of achieving a successful implementation You will have the ability to weigh the trade-offs between usability and performance needs to ensure our clients are getting the best value. Building strong relationships, effective communication, and diligent client follow-up will be integral to sustaining ongoing success.

Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:




Evaluate proposed solutions for clients to determine the use of best practices and that recommended approaches align with client’s needs.
Translate functional business requirements into a D365 application configuration design
Collaborate with clients to determine functional business requirements and design documents for custom D365 requirements
Work closely with software developers, project managers, and systems testers to translate business requirements into successful technical deliveries
Configure and test D365 module configurations to ensure delivered solutions fully satisfy client’s functional requirements
Identify business processes, roles within those processes, and develop workflow diagrams with multiple swim lanes using Microsoft Visio or other industry standard tools
Identify business/project risk and mitigate or communicate, as necessary
Provide clear and articulate documentation for all phases of the D365 implementation lifecycle
Guide and support clients with User Acceptance testing solutions
Conduct peer reviews for D365 application configuration design and adherence to best practices, standards, procedures, and methodologies
Maintain productive and successful client relationships, continually exceeding customer expectations


Qualifications

7+ years of applicable experience
Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Finance Functional Consultant Associate
Effective business analysis skills in understanding client needs and delivering appropriate solutions
Experience with Dynamics Finance reporting and custom Dynamics reporting development
Accounting/Finance certification is an asset
Must have participated in 3+ end-to-end Microsoft Dynamics AX ERP or D365 F&SC implementations
Working experience of integrations with third party applications
Knowledge of Azure DevOps to maintain the version control and deployment of the package from one environment to another
Working knowledge of Incident Management, Change Management, and Release Management

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Description:

Fannie Mae is seeking a seasoned Enterprise Architect (EA) to be an integral member of a highly dynamic Portfolio Architecture Team supporting InfoSec and Digital Workplace. The candidate must have hands-on experience in proactively and holistically guiding transformation and optimization initiatives. The ideal EA candidate is expected to help Fannie Mae business organizations plan, design, innovate, orchestrate, facilitate, navigate, and operationalize InfoSec and Digital Workplace initiatives.

Lead the creation or evolution of the EA function, including the coordination of an appropriately balanced pursuit of enterprise information systems, data, technical and solution architecture viewpoints of stakeholders, product owners and agile development teams.
Understanding, advocating and supporting the enterprise's business and InfoSec and Digital Workplace strategies
Leading the identification and analysis of enterprise business drivers to derive enterprise business, information, technical and solution architecture requirements; analyzing industry, technology and market trends to determine their potential impacts on the enterprise
Analyzing the current business and IT environment to detect vulnerabilities and other critical deficiencies and recommend solutions for improvement
Leading and facilitating the creation of governing principles to guide solution decision making for the enterprise
Ensuring that the optimal governance structure and compliance activities are associated with EA compliance
Leading the development of an implementation plan for the EA, based on business requirements and IT strategies; overseeing EA implementation, ongoing EA refinement activities, and the documentation of all EA design and analysis work
Participating with program/project teams to fit solutions to architecture across all viewpoints
Defining organizational requirements for the resources, structures and cultural changes necessary to support the EA
Promoting the EA process, outcomes and results to the organization, including the enterprise's IT and business leaders; this includes assessing (through appropriate metrics) and communicating the achievement and impact of the EA, as well as leading the development and execution of an EA communication and education plan

Education and Training and Experience:

Degree in business management, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study
AWS, Azure, GCP, CISSP, Agile, PMP, ITIL, SCRUM or other IT relevant certifications Preferred
10 to 15 years of experience in at least two IT disciplines (such as technical cloud architecture, solution architecture, network management, application development, middleware design, information analysis, database management or operations management) in a heterogeneous environment or five years of experience in solution architecture, business analysis or business strategic planning
Prior experience supporting InfoSec and Digital Workplace efforts supporting Cloud Strategies, Cloud Migration Efforts (Azure/AWS/GCP), DevOps/SecOps and playing an influential role supporting Digital Transformation
Familiarity with banking or mortgage providers, their processes, enterprise architectures, and strategic directions
Familiarity with Industry Treads in Business Systems, COTS, ServiceNow, Office 365, SalesForce
Solid understanding of IT Governance, Enterprise Architectures, IT Policies, Directives, Mandates, and Cybersecurity guidelines (NIST 800-53 and 800-207 for example)
In-depth understanding of IT Service Management, Networking, Monitoring Solutions, Data/Solution Solutions, Cybersecurity Operations & Compliance, Business Continuity, and Disaster Recovery, Identity, and Access Management.

Required Knowledge and Skills:

Enterprise Architecture Framework (EAF)
Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF)
Subject matter expertise in Cloud and Information Security.
Understanding of FISMA, FedRamp, ATOs
Exceptional interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation and negotiation
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent analytical skills
Excellent planning and organizational skills
Knowledge of all components of a holistic EA
Knowledge of business re-engineering principles and processes
Basic knowledge of financial analysis and models
Familiarity with graphical modeling approaches

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $71.47 - $80.00 per hour

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Reston, VA 20191

The American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) is currently searching for an association sales and marketing professional to lead the strategy, planning, negotiation, contract execution, and management of ASCE's business partner relationships.

Reporting to the Managing Director, Grants and Business Development, the director serves business units across ASCE, facilitating cross functional team collaboration between senior management, member services, marketing, technology, legal, and finance to drive results.

Responsibilities include:

Hiring, training, and supervising the sales and sales support staff
Managing the day-to-day sales functions including working with the sales staff in responding to requests for proposals (RFPs) from customers/prospects and developing custom pricing packages
Developing and managing the annual departmental operating budget
Implementing new revenue-generating ideas and driving business case development
Managing key ASCE board directed initiatives, including Partners program
Drafting and delivering management presentations on strategic initiatives and new partnership relationships
Leading deal negotiations to closure
Working with internal departments to streamline deliverables of sold products and services
Reviewing, and adjusting if needed, sales operating procedures to ensure expectations across the organization
Acting as key sales contact for both internal and external customers
Managing and prioritizing sales deadlines to achieve revenue goals

Ideal candidates will have:

Four-year degree in business, marketing, or related discipline (MBA a plus); or equivalent broad work experience with related specialized knowledge
10 + years' experience selling and/or managing the sale of print and digital advertising, sponsorships, and exhibits; experience with other non-dues revenue areas including affinity programs strongly preferred
Demonstrated success increasing revenue/margin growth and growing a program from strategy to implementation
Excellent customer and relationship management skills, including credibility and influencing skills at senior levels and across all functions
Expertise in sales processes and implementation
Some business analysis background, including Salesforce reporting
Strong command of Excel and PowerPoint
Demonstrated ability in business-to-business (B2B) sales
Product management experience
High level of emotional intelligence

The American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) is a global nonprofit professional membership association dedicated to the advancement of the civil engineering profession in order to serve the public good. To accomplish ASCE's mission, ASCE staff works together as a team, based on a foundation of trust, striving for individual and organizational excellence. To achieve our shared goals, we maintain a relentless focus on members and a commitment to continuously grow and improve individually and collectively.

We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team - one that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better business results. All qualified candidates including historically excluded individuals, protected veterans, women, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

This position has hybrid work from home flexibility.

For consideration, submissions of interest must contain a resume and cover letter with salary requirements.

We are seeking a Sr. Business Analyst to join our growing team. The qualified applicants will become part of the Enterprise Data Analytics Services (EDAS) program for a large federal agency in Alexandria, VA. Hybrid work options are available.

The Business Analyst is responsible for managing the development and maintenance of project documentation. Gathering and analyzing company data to identify vulnerabilities in processes and devise data-driven solutions for improvements. Responsibilities/Duties:
